Her son helps her serve the customers when he gets home from school and her husband helps her financially with his job. Rosa sells from the house where she lives now, although she would like to open a store in her own house, so if her friend returns from the U.S. she will have her own established business. 

The expectations she has for her business are opening another store in her own house and then having two businesses. One in the house she takes care of and one in her own house. Her husband and her son would help her manage them.

Rosa has asked for a Kiva loan to buy more products for the store, such as: basic grains, dairy products and other consumable goods, in order to generate more income. Her plans for the future are establishing her two businesses and in this way meeting her goals. One of them is for her son to graduate from the university and the other is for her husband to be the main person running the other store so he can safely leave the job he has now.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products and other consumable products.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is 52 years old. He is married to a farmer. They have six children aged between four and seventeen. He has been selling sugar and maize flour for the past five years. With this loan, he wants to buy more maize flour and sugar to sell. The profits from his business will be used to pay his children's school fees. He is very thankful for his previous loan, which helped him a lot.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Niyonsenga

texts.en: Niyonsenga has three children aged between three and eleven. She sells bedsheets. She has been in this business for six years. With this loan, she wants to buy more bedsheets to sell. The profits from her business will be reinvested in the business. Niyonsenga is very thankful for previous loans, which have helped her business.

loans.use: to buy more bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Anibal Enrique

texts.es:
Anibal Enrique tiene 34 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos Xavier y Joselin. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Anibal Enrique  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en la ciudad de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, ranger y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito podrá incrementar las siembrs de maíz. El sueño es tener una buena cosecha para poder tener buenos ingresos para ayudar a los hijos a que estudien.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.

"Esta muy agradecido por el anterior crédito porque le ha servido de mucha ayuda para la siembra de maíz y compra de fertilizantes".
texts.en:
Anibal Enrique is 34 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children, Xavier and Joselin. He lives in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos.

This communal bank is called VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE. It is located in the community of Sibimbe, belonging to the Ventanas canton. It has 20 members who work in short cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice. 

Anibal Enrique is a farmer who plants corn and rice. He also raises chickens and pigs. He does his buying and selling in the city of Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and insecticide. With the support of the loan, he will be able to to increase his corn crop. His dream is to have a good harvest in order to have good income to help his children go to school.

In his free time, he plays sports. 

He is very grateful for the previous loan, because it helped him a lot with planting the corn and buying fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and insecticide

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en: Fidele is 44 years old. He sells cooking oil and maize flour. He has been in the business for the past two years. He wants a loan to buy more cooking oil and maize flour to sell. He plans to save the profits for future investment in his business.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en:
Efia lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and four children at Breman near Abura, Ghana. She sells packaging material, which she has done for six years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying for their utilities and accommodation bills. 

Efia will use her loan to purchase more packaging material to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more packaging material to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging from 7 to 12 years old. She describes herself as innovative. 

Mary operates a retail store where she sells clothes she makes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are residents from the nearby town. She says her biggest business challenges are high prices of household items and delays of payment from customers. 

Mary will use the KES 20,000 to buy fabrics. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. Mary also farms to increase her business income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock, undertake renovations and expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 22 года. Он холост. Фируз живет с родителями. Он три года как работает таксистом. Кредит просит для покупки запчастей и установки оборудования для природного газа.
texts.en: Firuz lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Firuz has been working as a taxi driver for the past three years. He is requesting this loan to purchase spare parts and to install equipment that will allow him to fuel his car with natural gas.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and install natural gas equipment

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with four children. She is 56 years old and lives in Militar, Tukuran in the Philippines. Lucia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

Lucia has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoos and soaps. She has been a member of microfinance organisation GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Lucia wants to build a house and to support her children to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoos and soaps, for her store

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 56 years old and married. She has five children living with her in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Nilda is engaged in raising pigs to make a living. She's been in this business for five years, and every month she earns PHP 19,000 from her business. In 2011, Nilda joined GDMPC. She has requested PHP 30,000 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. When all of her animals are grown, Nilda hopes to sell them at a higher price to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Rocaya

texts.en: Rocaya is 45 years old and lives in in Panduma, Tukuran. For over four years, Rocaya has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home use products. She earns PHP 3,000 a month for these activities. In 2011, Rocaya joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo and soaps for resale.

loans.name: 06.11.10 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lộc has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to make rice wine. Lộc is 61 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 10-Đông Vệ solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

This is Lộc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lộc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lộc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lộc hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to make rice wine

loans.name: 06.11.09 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to make rice wine. Thanh is 31 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 09-Đông Vệ solidarity group.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

This is Thanh's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Marilou is a widow and has five children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a general store. Marilou has been in this business for eight years, and she earns PHP 5,000 a month. In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC. Marilou is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo and soaps for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 65 years old. She is married and lives in the Philippines. Teresita has a small store that sells snacks and soft drinks. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks and soft drinks to sell at her store. Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice field.

loans.name: 06.11.11 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Xuân is 48 years old and she is married with 1 child. Xuân is the group leader of the 11-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Xuân lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Xuân's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xuân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is from Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children.

Antonia owns and operates a general store for a living. She's been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Antonia joined GDMPC. Antonia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio is 64 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. Eleuterio has a food retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. He has had this business for 9 years.

He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Eleuterio has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Eleuterio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Magaly Alexandra

texts.es:
Magaly Alexandra tiene 24 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con la hijo. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Magaly Alexandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en la ciudad de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, líquido para convatir las plagas, insecticidas, ranger, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito podra mejorar los cultivos y convatir a las plagas. El sueño es salir adelante con la familia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar en especial el indor.
texts.en:
Magaly Alexandra, 24, is married and lives with her husband and child.  She lives in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

This bank, San Francisco de Sibimbe Communal Bank, is located in Sibimbe Precinct in Ventanas Canton.  The 20 members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture growing corn and rice.

Magaly Alexandra farms corn.  She also raises chickens.  She makes her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas.

She's requesting the loan to buy seeds, liquid weedkiller to combat pests, insecticide, Ranger, fertilizer, and manure.  With the help of the loan she'll be able to improve her crops and combat pests.

Her dream is to get ahead with her family.  In her free time she especially likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seed, weedkiller, insecticide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en: Leatitia, 36, sells spices. She has been running this business for a couple of months, as before she was selling peanuts and fish. She wants to buy more spices for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell.

loans.name: Marie Diane

texts.en: Marie Diane, 33, is married with two children, aged two and five years. She sells clothes and has been in this business for ten years. With the loan, she will add more skirts and blouses for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house she has recently started constructing.

loans.use: to buy more skirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 38, is married woman  with two children, aged eight and fourteen. She describes herself as honest, determined and trustworthy. Lucy operates a retail store where she sells household items such as eggs, drinks such as water and soda, rice, cooking fat, sugar, etc. She has been involved in this business for 12 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a strategic market area and her primary customers are business people from the market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating prices of household items.

Lucy will use the loan of 70,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy cereals and eggs for resale. Her business goal is to run her business activities in a more spacious, permanent business premises within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will build a house for her family. In addition to this business, Lucy also sells furniture.

loans.use: to buy cereals and eggs.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose, 28, is married to a driver. She sells clothes and has spent six years in this business. She wants a loan to buy more clothes for resale. She plans to use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Donisa

texts.en:
Donisa is a 28-year old resident of Camanga, Tukuran, in the Philippines. She provides for her three children's needs from the small income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month that she earns from her piggery business. She has run this business for three years to supplement her husband's income. 

This year, Donisa has become a member of GDMPC, and has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for her pigs. She wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Temistocles Abdon

texts.es:
Temistocles Abdon tiene 37 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Temistocles Abdon se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se ddeica a la crianza de pollos. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas cada quince días.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, insecticidas, semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a tener mejores cultivos y por ende mejorar los ingresos. El sueño es salir adelante. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Temistocles Abdon is 37 years old. He is single and lives with his parents; he has no children. He lives in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos Province.

His communal bank is called VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE. It is located in the district of Sibimbe, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. This communal bank has 20 members, who dedicate themselves to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice. 

Temistocles Abdon works in agriculture, planting corn and rice; he also works raising chickens. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas every fifteen days. 

He is requesting the loan to buy urea, insecticides, seeds, fertilizers and manure. The support from this loan will help him have better crops, and in the end to improve his income. His dream is to get ahead in life. 

In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a widow and has three children. Yaa extracts palm oil and palm kernel oil for sale in Breman near Abura. As a widow, she uses her income to feed her family and pay her children’s school fees.  

Yaa will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil for sale. With the new profit, she wishes to buy a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels to extract oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 56 years old and widowed with five children. 

Alfredo owns and operates a business providing "trysikad" (pedicab) services in the local community. He has been in this business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Alfredo joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 5,800 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Rosemelba

texts.en:
Rosemelba is from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 67 years old. Rosemelba is married and has one child. 

To earn a living, Rosemelba runs a general store, where she sells a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. 

Rosemelba has been in her business for three years and earns 10,800 PHP a month from these activities. 

Rosemelba is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2009, Rosemelba joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 24 years old, married and has two children. 

Cristina owns and operates a business buying and selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Cristina joined GDMPC. 

Cristina is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en:
Feride is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with three children ranging from thirteen years old to five yeras old (in picture are only two children). She lives in in the southwestern part of Kosovo. Feride works as a hairdresser and her husband works as a baker.

Until now, the family used to live in an old house and tried to save money to build a house. They have finally managed to start building their new home to improve their living conditions and have paid for the building materials, but they still need money to pay for the workers because the money they generate in income and have in savings is not enough to finish the house. The loan Feride is requesting will pay for workers to complete her family's home.

Her goal is to have a bigger space and offer better security for her family. Feride and her family are very happy for the new house and are very thankful for this support!

loans.use: To pay for workers to complete her family's home

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.en:
Takhmina is 18 years old. She is not married yet and lives with her parents. Since her parents' income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Takhmina decided to start a new business to rent out wedding dresses in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her family’s finances. 

She studied at a course called “To Get Ahead” at a woman's organization and got a certificate about her knowledge in business. She organized her business, and she has been busy with this business for six months. 

She wants to widen her assortment but does not have enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy wedding dresses and necklaces for widening the product assortment for new business. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support. Please, help her because you are the only ones who can help her.

loans.use: To buy wedding dresses and necklaces for developing new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Vevencia is providing habal-habal or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance.

Vevencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future,Vevencia hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old and married with 1 child. She owns and operates a rice production business. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns 9,600 PHP a month. In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 25-year-old married man. He has a son who is 5 years old. He describes himself as ambitious, easy going and a go-getter man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as cooking fat, cereals, flour, sugar, salt, water, sodas, etc.. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of household items. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy electronics for running a new electronics retail store. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with profits made. Henry also runs motorcycle transportation services which increases his business income. Previously, he was selling milk to residents.

loans.use: to buy electronics items for resale

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita of Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur has been raising pigs for more than 5 years and earns 5,200 PHP per month. She’s 33 years old now, yet continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to give adequate life for her 2 children. She been a member of GDMPC since 2011. 

In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she borrows an amount of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Julita hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Miljuan

texts.en:
Miljuan is 26 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. Miljuan has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Miljuan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Miljuan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Flordeliz  has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Flordeliz has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Flordeliz hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.fr: Angeline est une femme de 42 ans fianiée, mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 10 ans, tous vont encore à l'école. Elle aussi deux personnes à sa charge. Elle exerce une activité d'élévage depuis 1 ans déjà (elle achète les poussins, les élève ensuite revend) elle fonctionne à merveille mais son capital n'est pas élévé alors, elle est obligé à chaque fois d'attendre que le stock acheté pour élever grandisse, qu'elle le vende avant de racheter de nouveaux poussins d'où la rupture de stock quotienne qui cause l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle tout le temps. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grande quantité des poussins et aussi la provende ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante mais aussi de réaliser un plus gros profit. Le benéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir son activité( augmenter le nombre de poussins) et aussi à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Angeline is 42 years old, engaged, and mother of four children between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. All of her children still go to school. She also has two other people living in her care.

She has been raising animals for one year now (she buys chicks, raises them, and resells them). Her business is going very well, but she doesn't have much capital, so each time that she buys chicks, she has to wait for them to grow and then resell them before she can go out and buy new chicks. So, she is often out of stock, which means that her customers are often dissatisfied.

She is seeking this loan to buy a large quantity of chicks and some animal feed, which will not only allow her to satisfy her already growing customer base, but also earn more profit. The extra earnings that this loan will help bring in will help her to expand her business (increase her stock of chicks) and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of animal feed and baskets of chicks

loans.name: Ruthchel

texts.en:
Ruthchel is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 27 years old and married. To make a living, she manages a fish vending business, while her husband does the fishing. She has been in her business for three years and earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ruthchel joined GDMPC. Ruthchel is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Abdunabi

texts.ru:
Абдунаби проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Абдунаби зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Животноводством он занимается восемь лет. 
Абдунаби просит кредит для закупа телят с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Abdunabi lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is 45 years old. He is married, with two children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdunabi earns a living by raising cattle. He  raises cattle by his home. He has been in animal husbandry for eight years. Abdunabi is applying for a loan to buy calves and expand his headcount.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. Liza provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for the maintenance.

Liza became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush lives in Gndevaz village with her husband, son and daughter. Anush and her husband are involved in agriculture: they breed cows, lambs, hens and grow fruit trees. Currently Anush keeps a cow and two oxen. She would like to increase the number of cows to gather more milk. This loan will help Anush to purchase two cows and a calf. This will allow her to sell more milk and increase her income. Anush will improve her household conditions and ensure a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a calf.

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Lucena has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lucena became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Lucena hopes to improve her business for the education of her grand children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 23-year-old married woman. She has three children whose ages range from three months to nine years. She describes herself as an innovative and hardworking woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a busy shopping centre and her primary customers are residents from nearby estates. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of ingredients. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients to prepare the meals she sells. Her business goal is to expand her business into a hotel business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land and build a house for her family. This is the first loan she is requesting from SMEP DTM. Virginia also works at a petrol station as an attendant which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to prepare the meals she sells.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Lorena and her husband have a repair shop that repairs damaged motorcycles. They have had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy tools needed for the repair shop. Lorena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lorena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the repair shop.

loans.name: Magdalena  Eloisa

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer de 25 años que vive junto con su esposo Edwin y su hijo. Ellos viven en la parroquia de Puerto Quito, una ciudad relativamente pequeña que actualmente se encuentra en proceso de crecimiento debido al ecoturismo. Esta ciudad se encuentra a unos 140 Km de la capital y corre a la par del puente del río Caoni. Puerto Quito es considerado parte de la sierra ecuatoriana, no obstante su clima es más costero. La ciudad se encuentra dentro de la zona del bosque tropical y su temperatura promedio es de alrededor de 25 grados. 
Magdalena se dedica a la venta de cosméticos mientras que su esposo trabaja como electricista desde hace 5 años. Magdalena está solicitando este crédito para poder comprar más productos y así atender a más clientes. Magdalena no ha encontrado demasiados obstáculos ni dificultades para seguir con su negocio lo único seria la falta de efectivo para seguir creciendo. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener su casa propia, y este crédito sería un gran paso para poder lograr aquello.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 25 years old, lives with her husband Edwin and their son. They live in the Puerto Quito Parish, a relatively small city that is currently growing due to ecotourism. This city is about 140Km from the capital and runs alongside the Caoni River bridge. Puerto Quito is considered part of the Ecuadorian Highlands; however, its climate is more coastal. The city is in the tropical forest area and its average temperature is around 25ºC.

Magdalena works in selling cosmetics, while her husband has worked as an electrician for 5 years. Magdalena is requesting this loan to buy more products and serve more customers. Magdalena has not had too many obstacles or difficulties in running her business. The only challenge would be the lack of cash in order to continue growing. She dreams of having her own home one day. This loan would be a great step in achieving this goal.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Accion just funded a young entrepreneur from Miami, Florida! From a young age, Richard noticed the importance of cell phones to cut family banking costs. In particular, in rural communities like the one he grew up in Venezuela, the use of cell phones to bank online and pay bills dramatically cut back the cost for a farmer in transportation fees to and from cities to meet with their banker.  

Richard wanted to help more people in his community to purchase cell phones but noted how expensive they were. Richard knew that because he lived in the United States that he could purchase cell phones in Miami for much cheaper than in Venezuela. From this realization, Richard's business idea was born. 

Richard's business focuses on the sale of cellular phones and other electronics to buyers in Latin American countries. He discovered that, on average, electronics are usually three to five times more expensive abroad than in the United States. Richard sells his electronics to companies throughout Latin America to sell in rural communities at a more reasonable price.  

As an entrepreneur in his early 30's, Richard continues to study while running his business; all in an effort to better prepare him for future success. Richard was hard hit by the financial crisis three years ago and was forced to diversify his products in order to continue to provide for his family. Richard is slowly taking steps to formalize and build his business in the hopes of experiencing growth that will enable him to hire employees and move to an office location. Richard is requesting a loan from ACCION to purchase new electronics for re-sale to be able to meet the growing demand for his services. Help this young entrepreneurs' business grow!

loans.use: to purchase electronics for re-sale.

loans.name: Asili

texts.en:
Asili is a married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 7 years to 19 years. She describes herself as a visionary woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells items such as milk, bread, snacks, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a residential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more milk for resale. Her business goal is to be a supplier of milk within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her second loan after the previous one in which she received 20,000 KES and managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Myrna has a small store that sells spices and vegetables. She has had this business for nine years. 

She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy more vegetables and spices to resell.

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to resell.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a 30-year-old single man. He has two children. He describes himself as a creative young man. He operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea and snacks. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge as the low purchasing power from customers which sometimes leads to food spoiling. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients to prepare meals to sell. His business goal is to run another restaurant within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open many bigger restaurants. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Elizabeth has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Elizabeth became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 30 years old and lives in the town of Msambweni, Kenya. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells different types of consumer goods. Due to his visionary nature, he saw the need to diversify his business lines of operation and therefore bought a motorcycle taxi which he operates while his wife spends most of her time running the shop.

To help expand his business, Mohamed has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy a new motorcycle, and will help Mohamed to generate greater profits and help pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Marie Claudine

texts.fr: Marie Claudine est une femme agée de 37 ans fiancée ayant 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 04 et 16 ans tous sont scolariés.Elle exerce cette activité(vendeuse ) depuis 05 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. De part la quatlité des services et produits proposés à sa clientèle,Marie Claudine a acquis une clientèle  qui s'est fidèlisée au fil des années. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de marchandises (boissons etc...)et d'accroitre son chiffre d'affaires. la marge bénéficiaire gagnée l'aidera dans l'agrandissement de son activité.
texts.en: Marie-Claudine is a 37-year old woman who is engaged and has five children ranging from four to 15 years old; the children are all at school. She has been excercising this activity (saleswoman) for the past five years in one of the capital's districts. As a result of the quality of the services and products she offers to her customers, Marie-Claudine has built up a loyal customer base over the years.This loan will allow her to increase her stock (drinks etc.) and to increase her turnover. The profit she makes will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her restaurant.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La sra. Blanca esta casada, tiene dos hijos menores a quien debe mantener.
Blanca tiene un puesto de venta de ropas, el cual había comprado con mucho esfuerzo, ella surte su negocio con ropas varias para grandes y pequeños y con sus ingresos mantiene a su familia.
El crédito utilizará para la compra de ropas varias como camisas, polleras, blusas, etc. con los cuales busca atraer aún más la atención y compra de sus clientes.
texts.en: Blanca’s married and has two minor children to support.  She has a stand that she bought with much effort where she sells clothes.  She stocks her business with various clothes for adults and children and supports her family with the income.  She will use the loan to buy various clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses, etc. to attract more customer attention and purchases.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Estrella" tiene 15 integrantes, todas ellas se dedican a actividades diferentes pero son muy activas y trabajadoras por lo que se nota un grupo unido y muy próspero.
Claudia, una de las integrantes del grupo se dedica a la peluquería, con este trabajo ella sale adelante y procura una futuro mejor para su familia y para ella. Su sueño es contar con mas comodidades en su peluquería y ofrecer mayores servicios a su clientela.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de peluquería como: tinturas, guantes, hebillas, gomitas, etc. que le servirán para realizar peinados a su clientela.
texts.en:
The group "Nueva Estrella" has 15 members. All of them are involved in different activities but they are all very active and hard-working and for this reason it is clearly a very united and prosperous group. 

Claudia, one of the members of the group, is a hair-dresser. With this work she is advancing towards a  better future for her family and for herself. Her dream is to have more a more comfortable hairdresser's shop and to offer a wider service to her customers. She is asking for a loan to buy hairdressing supplies such as dies, gloves, hair-clips, lacky bands etc which she will use to do her customers' hair.

loans.use: to buy gloves, dyes, hair-clips, elastic bands, hair-sprays etc.

loans.name: San Alfredo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Alfredo esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que en su mayoría son ama de casa y por ello sus negocios son dentro de casa y generalmente la ganancia es pequeña pero que de igual forma siguen apostando por el comité con esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante.
Una de las señoras, Angela es vendedora en el mercado municipal, para poder seguir con el negocio necesita de productos nuevos para llenar el stock y de esa forma ir creciendo como vendedora. En el mercado la señora vende bebidas refrescantes como gaseosas, jugos hasta bebidas alcohólicas además aceites, harinas,huevos,etc. su ideal es surtir mas sus produstos y asi satisfacer aún más la canasta familiar de sus clientes y generar más ingresos para ella y su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar bebidas, huevos, aceites, harinas, etc.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Alfredo is made up mostly of women who are stay-at-home mothers who run businesses out of their homes. Their earnings are generally small, but they continue to believe in what they are doing as a group and are motivated to get ahead. 

One of the women, Anglea, is a vendor in the municipal market. In order to continue in her business she needs to buy products to stock her inventory. In the market she sells drinks such as sodas and juices, as well as alcoholic beverages.  She also sells oils, flour, eggs and other items.  She wishes to carry more products and thus be able to better satisfy her clients and generate more income for her family.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy beverages, eggs, oils, flour and other items.

loans.use: to buy beverages, eggs, oils, flour and other items.

loans.name: Virgen De La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de la Candelaria esta conformado por 12 miembros en su totalidad mujeres que se dedican a todo tipo de ventas como comestibles, ropas, dulces, etc. El comité se encuentra en su 11 ciclo del programa mostrando gran compromiso y responsabilidad.
La señora Graciela tiene 42 años de edad esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, se dedica al rubro del comercio.Le encantaría seguir creciendo a nivel laboral y personal, agrandar su negocio y así tener mas variedades que ofrecer a su clientela y de igual manera poder ofrecer mayores comodidades a su familia.
La señora desea utilizar el crédito para comprar panificados, lácteos, verduras, yerba, etc. que serían vendidas por ella misma.
texts.en:
The Virgen de la Candelaria Communal Bank is composed of 12 members, all women, who are dedicated to all kinds of sales, such as food, clothing, sweets, etc. The bank is in its 11th loan cycle in the program showing its great commitment and sense of responsibility. 

Sra. Graciela is 42 years old, married and has three children. She works in trade. She would love to continue growing at a business and personal level, to expand her business and have a greater variety of products to offer her clientele and at the same time to be able to offer her family more conveniences.

She wants to use her loan to purchase baked goods, milk products, vegetables and yerba, which she will sell herself.

loans.use: to puchase merchandise such as baked goods, milk products and meat.

loans.name: San Cayetano Ll Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano II esta compuesto por 17 intergrantes todas vecinas de la comunidad que desarrollan actividades distintas e independientes algunas se dedican a la ventas de ropas otras son macateras, algunas se dedican a la cría de ganado, entre otras actividades.
La señora Pabla es modista, se dedica a todo tipo de confección de ropas ya sea un arreglo mínimo o hacer ropas, la señora gracias a su esfuerzo, responsabilidad ya tiene una clientela fija que confía en su trabajo.Es por ellos y para su ganancia personal a la vez que ella deses satisfacer más los gustos de su cientela y aumentar la demanda.
Ella desea sacar el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de materiales como agujas, telas, cierres, etc y también para invertir en su local donde atiende a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano II” committee has 17 members who are all neighbors who carry out a variety of independent activities.  Some sell clothes and others are street merchants.  Some raise cattle, among other activities.  

Pabla is a dressmaker; she makes all sorts of clothes and does everything from simple alterations to making complete outfits.  Thanks to her effort and responsibility she has a regular clientele who trusts in her work.  It’s because of them and also to meet her own needs that she wants to satisfy their needs and increase demand.  

She wants to take out a loan to buy larger amounts of supplies like needles, fabric, zippers, etc. and also to invest in the locale where she tends to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La señora Eleuteria tiene 3 hijas y posee una despensa en su domicilio.
Trabaja en este rubro hace 15 años por ello ya tiene una gran clientela formada con una variedad de productos que hace que su despensa sea la mas completa del barrio. Se recata el gran sacrificio de la señora ya que ella misma va a comprar los productos para que al venderlos no sean muy caros y de esa forma también sea garantizar la calidad.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como verduras, frutas, lácteos, carnes etc. para surtir aún más su despensa y así poder generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Eleuteria has 3 daughters and operates a store from her own home. She has worked in this manner for some 15 years. Therefore, she has a large clientele drawn by a variety of products, which makes her store the most complete in the barrio. Somewhat hesitantly, she recounts her grand sacrifice, since she herself goes to buy the products, so that selling them won't be too expensive and in this form, also, the quality can be guaranteed.

Eleuteria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, including vegetables, fruit, milk products, meat, etc., to supply her store even better, and thus, to be able to generate greater income.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as vegetables, fruit, milk products, meat, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Villa Conavi Group

texts.es:
El comité Villa Conavi esta constituido por 12 miembros mujeres que son vecinas del mismo barrio.El comité es muy unido,el objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar,fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Aurora se dedica a la venta de ropas para mujeres, les ofrece remeras, camisas, pantalones, polleras, etc que son de una calidad a un precio competitivo, ella desea agrandar su stock con prendas variadas para poder satisfacer la demanda y así generar mayor ingreso a su canasta familiar.
El crédito solicitado por la señora sería para continuar con el negocio de las ventas e ir aumentando el número de clientes y con eso aumentar sus ingresos que le son de bastante ayuda para ella y su familia, con este crédito va a comprar ropas como remeras, pantalones, polleras, etc,
texts.en:
The “Villa Conavi” committee has 12 members who are women from the same neighborhood.  The committee is very united and each member’s objective is to work and foster the spirit of solidarity and to reach the program’s highest level.

One of the members is Aurora.  She sells women’s clothes like t-shirts, shirts, pants, skirts, etc. that are good quality at competitive prices.  She wants to expand her stock with varied articles of clothing to meet demand and generate higher income.

The loan she’s requested is to continue in business selling and increasing the number of her customers with which she will increase income which is of great help for her and her family.  With this loan she will buy t-shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité San Antonio esta conformado por 13 señoras emprendedoras, que buscan mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y la de sus familias. El comité es muy unido y responsable, las integrantes se encuentran comprometidas al proyecto y buscan la mejor manera de salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus familias a mejorar su calidad de vida.
la señora María tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa donde ofrece productos de limpieza, higiene persona, también panificados, lácteos y  gaseosas.
El crédito solicitado sería para aumentar la cantidad de productos que ella podrá ofrecer a un mejor precio y calidad.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is made up of 13 women entrepreneurs seeking to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. The group is very united and responsible. The members are committed to the project and seek the best way forward to help their families improve their quality of life.

Maria has a small shop in her house where she sells cleaning products and personal hygiene products, as well as baked goods, dairy products and soft drinks. The loan she is requesting would be to increase the amount of products that she can offer at a better quality and price.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, hygiene products, baked goods, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El cómite Mujeres Activas es un grupo muy activo, antiguo y unido , que a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes siempre saben salir adelante , el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 18º , tienen ahorros y caja chica que les facilitan el retiro del proximo crédito.
La sra. Graciela, tiene una mercería, en ella ofrece variadas mercaderías a su clientela y así genera ingresos económicos a su hogar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como: cintas, hilos, encajes, etc. para poder ofrecer a la venta.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) is a longtime group that is very active and close-knit.  Despite facing a few challenges, they always know how to get ahead.  This group is in their 18th loan cycle.  Their savings and petty cash were used to pay off their previous loan.  

Sra. Graciela has a sewing supply shop where she offers various goods to her customers as a way of generating household income.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as ribbons, thread, lace, and other items that she can offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy ribbons, thread, lace, and other items.

loans.name: Peguaho Group

texts.es:
El comité Peguaho esta compuesto por 12 integrantes mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias, actualmente se encuentra en el 3er ciclo del programa con muchas expectativas de ir continuando.Las integrantes del comité se han caracterizado por ser trabajadoras, responsables y sobre todo emprendedoras.
Una integrante del grupo, la señora Cindy se dedica a la venta de ropas para mujeres, es un negocio muy competitivo por ello la señora se encarga de elegir las ropas de mejor calidad a un buen precio.
El pedido del préstamo sería para utilizar en la compra de mercaderías como remeras, vestidos, polleras, pantalones, etc. La señora planea llegar a una mayor cantidad de clientes para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The committee named “Peguaho” consists of 12 female members who engage in various activities.  They are currently in their third loan cycle of the program and have great expectation of continuing.  The members of this committee are known for being hardworking, responsible, and above all, enterprising.  

One of the members is Sra. Cindy, who sells women’s clothing.  Since she is in a very competitive business, Sra. Cindy must select and deliver clothes that are of high quality and have an affordable price.  Her loan request will be used to buy merchandise such as T-shirts, dresses, skirts, trousers, and other items.  She plans to reach a large number of customers so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, dresses, skirts, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El comité Bendición tiene 19 integrantes,todas ellas fijaron como objetivo principal superarse como personas y como trabajadoras dentro de su área de actividad respectiva.
La sra. Bárbara se dedica a la venta de productos varios, lo que le hace más emprendedora aún, ya que busca progresar en el rubro de la venta con varios productos que ofrecer, y así también a aportar a la canasta familiar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, lácteos, ropas, bijouteries, etc.
texts.en:
The Bendición group is made up of 19 members. All of the members are dedicated to improving themselves as people and as workers within their respective activities.

Bárbara makes a living selling a variety of products, which makes her even more entrepreneurial since she aims to progress in sales with many products on offer. This also allows her to contribute to the family income.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase baked goods, dairy products, clothing, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, dairy products, clothing, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 50 years old and married. She is from Caamanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She has three children who have helped her in taking care of their garden. 

They have been gardening for 22 years and earn 10,000 PHP a month. This year, Avelina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine lives in Geghi village with her parents and daughter. Kristine's parents are pensioners, and her daughter, Elen, is 4 years old. 

For many years, Kristine's parents have been involved in cattle breeding. They breed cows, pigs, lambs, hens and keep colonies of bees. 

Now Kristine is also involved in agriculture and plans to develop the family farm. With the help of this loan, Kristine plans to purchase more cattle as well as nine colonies of bees. This will allow Kristine to receive more milk, meat and honey, from the sales of which the family gathers its main income.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and colonies of bees.

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn is 24 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.

Cherlyn is providing habal-habal or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

Cherlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Cherlyn hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has children.
 
Maricel is providing habal-habal or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. 

Maribel has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Atom

texts.en: Atom lives in Yeghegnadzor with his wife and daughter. Atom is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows, hens and grows fruit trees. Atom would like to purchase one more calf for his farm, as well as forage to feed the cattle during winter. This loan will help Atom to implement these purposes and increase his income from agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Evelyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Evelyn became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Edia

texts.en: Edia is a member of PMPC. She 59 years old and widowed with five adult children. She decided  to become a member of PMPC to support her convenience store business. In the two years that her business has been operating, she has earned an average monthly income of PHP 2,000. She has used the profit to contribute to the daily needs of her family. She is seeking a loan through PMPC to purchase grocery stocks in order to increase her volume of sales and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stocks for her convenience store.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn  is  20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Manilyn has a convenience store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for two  years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Manilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Manilyn hopes to improve her business so that she can pay for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Yeghegnadzor town with her husband and mother-in-law. The family is involved in agriculture; they raise cattle and grow fruit trees. 

Marine has applied for this loan to purchase more cattle, which will allow her to increase the income from the sale of agricultural products. Development of agriculture is vital for Marine to get sufficient income and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une femme de 39 ans fiancée, mère de deux enfant de 7 et 9 ans, Elle commerçante  et avait ouvert un bar dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis 12 ans déjà. Grace à son accueil chaleureux et son expérience dans ce domaine, elle a conquis et fidéliser une clientèle. Marguerite aimerai agrandir son activité en instaurant en plus du détail que fait son bar un dépôt de boisson ou ses concurrents viendront s’approvisionner pour exposer dans leurs structure, mais son capital ne lui permet pas d'ou l'importance de ce crédit qui donnera cette opportunité. les bénéfices que lui apporteront ce crédit l'aideront non seulement à subvenir en partie aux besoins quotidiens de sa petite famille, mais aussi à augmenter son capital qu'elle réinvestira bien sur dans son bar.
texts.en: Marguerite is a 39-year old woman who is engaged and mother to two children of seven and nine years old respectively. She is a trader and opened a bar in one of the capital's districts, which she has been managing for 12 years now. Thanks to her warm welcome and her experience in this field, she has managed to build up a loyal customer base. Marguerite would like to expand her activity by adding to her retail business a drinks warehouse where her competitors would come and get supplies to display in their own businesses. However she does not have sufficient capital, hence the importance of this loan which will provide her with this opportunity. The profits which she will make thanks to this loan will help her not only to provide part of her family's daily needs, but also to increase her capital, which she will of course reinvest in her bar.

loans.use: to buy crates to open a drinks watehouse.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño cuenta con 13 miembros que se ocupan en la mayoría a la venta de alimentos ya sea de frutas y verduras o de alimentos preparados para la comercialización.
La señora María se dedica a la venta de mandiocas a su comunidad y también a gente que vive fuera de la comunidad.Le gustaría poder sembrar otras variedades de hortalizas o frutas para acrecentar su negocio y así también sus ingresos.
La señora utilizaría el crédito para invertir en su producto,ya que compraría mandiocas de mejor calidad para poderlas ofrecer a su clientela y que estas queden totalmente satisfechas.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño” communal bank has 13 members, the majority of whom sell foods, including fruits, vegetables, and prepared foods. 

María sells cassava roots in her community and also to people who live outside her community. She would like to be able to plant other kinds of vegetables or fruits in order to grow her business and her income.

She will use the loan to  invest in her product, a higher quality of cassava roots so that she can sell them at a better price to be able to offer her clientele so that they are totally satisfied.

loans.use: to buy cassava roots to sell

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children, age 3 and 6 years. He describes himself as a focused man. 

He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy town. He describes his biggest business challenge as the poor, inaccessible road network, especially in rainy season. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorbike. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a fleet of motorbikes so as to meet his customers' demands for transportation services. 

This is the first loan Dickson is receiving from SMEP DTM. In addition, he runs a retail shop, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en: Robinson is a 24-year-old man. He has no children yet. He is a hard working and determined man. He operates a retail store where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a busy market. He says his biggest business challenge is delayed payments from customers. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more phone accessories. His business goal is to run a cereal retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a van and educate his children. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories for his retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 35  años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos a cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío SANTA  ELENA  en el distrito de TAMBOGRANDE. Vive en zona rural del caserío y ya  cuenta con servicio básico de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla José es la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral contando con gran cantidad de cabezas de ganado, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace mas de 9 años, además se desempeña como peón agrícola en parcelas aledañas. Su esposa cría aves de corral y  lo apoya en toda  actividad que realiza. 
José ha solicitado un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles, lo que le servirá para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de ganado y así engordarlos para poderlos vender a un mejor precio y así seguir creciendo en su negocio lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage and has three children under his care. He lives in his own home, which is located in the hamlet of Santa Elena in the Tambogrande district. He lives in a rural area of the hamlet and has electricity in his home.

Jose raises sheep, pigs, and poultry birds and has many animals which he raises and fattens to then sell to the local market. He has been doing this for more than 9 years, and also works as an agricultural worker in neighboring plots of land. His wife raises poultry and supports him in all of the activities that he does.

Jose has asked for a loan of 2500 new soles which will allow him to purchase balanced feed to fatten his livestock and fatten them to be able to sell them at a better price and ensure that he can continue growing his business which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado.

loans.name: Llankachinapac De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
La socia Elsi tiene 37 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad de Trujillo pero vive en la hermosa provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La socia Elsi es ama de casa pero también en sus horas libres se dedica administrar su cabina de internet, la socia Elsi se encuentra todos los días en su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Elsi requiere el préstamo para comprar discos, memorias, usb, tinta, papel y otras cosas más. (La socia Elsi en la fotografia esta levantando la mano). 

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “LLankachinapac de Urubamba” en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de animales menores como gallinas y pollos, reparación de motos, servicio de internet, venta de comida de pollos, venta de abarrotes y otros brindan servicio de transportes.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
The member, Elsi, is 37 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She is a native of Trujillo but lives in the beautiful province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.  She is a housewife but also manages her internet café in her spare time.  She works in her business every day from 8:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening.  She has been engaged in this business for several years and it is going well.  At this time, Elsi is requesting the loan to purchase disks, memory, usb, ink, paper, and other items. (Elsi is raising her hand in the photograph).

This group is comprised of friends and neighbors that formed the “LLankachinapac de Urubamba” Communal Bank in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.  The communal bank is made up of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and strive daily to provide their children with a better future.  The members’ business activities include selling small animals such as hens and chickens, motorcycle repair, internet services, chicken dinner sales, grocery sales, and transportation services.

The members are grateful for the opportunity provided and are committed to making their respective payments according to the established terms.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco. The department of Cusco is in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It is known as a tourist area because of its archeological centers, historic district, scenery, and history.  It is a charming city in the country’s “Región del Sur”.  Cusco also is well-known for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because “Machupicchu”, one of the seven wonders of the world, is located here.

loans.use: to purchase disks, memory, usb, ink, paper, and other items.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles is 70 years old and married with three children. Angeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. Angeles has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and rice. Angeles aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Indira Melissa

texts.es:
Indira Melissa tiene 22 años y nació en Cali, Colombia. Indira logró terminar su carrera en administración de empresas en la Universidad Pública del Valle gracias a que obtuvo una beca completa por el estado Colombiano debido a su excelencia académica y porque su familia tiene un nivel de ingresos muy bajo.  

Indira Melissa tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en el Reino Unido y el apoyo de Kiva ayudaría a que Indira Melissa pueda pagar los cursos de preparación del TOEFL y la inscripción al examen. 

Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Indira Melissa quisiera dedicarse a  la investigación y docencia en una universidad pública donde pueda compartir los conocimientos adquiridos.

Aquí esta su historia:

Soy consciente que estudiar una Maestría en Gestión e Implementación de Proyectos de Desarrollo, en una de las mejores universidades del mundo, no podría tener una finalidad egoísta. Para mi es gratificante saber que es un sueño que no sólo es de beneficio propio sino que con la realización de éste, podré ser útil en mi región, en mi país, en la academia y sobretodo con los jóvenes del mañana. Esa es precisamente mi visión de futuro. Una realidad en la que el trabajo cobra sentido sólo cuando contribuye al bien común.

Ser una de las beneficiarias de Kiva sería resolver un obstáculo más de los muchos que ya he superado y de los que vendrán. Además, es ante todo un aliciente, una confirmación de que nada puede interponerse entre tu visión, tu sueño y tú. Porque de las pocas razones que quizás podrían barajarse para no hacer el posgrado, la falta de recursos económicos definitivamente es la última que aceptaría como barrera ante mi sueño. Esta no es más que mi firme convicción de esfuerzo, porque como bien lo dijo Gandhi “Nuestra recompensa se encuentra en el esfuerzo y no en el resultado. Un esfuerzo total es una victoria completa”.
texts.en:
Indira Melissa, age 22, was born in Cali, Colombia.  Indira managed to complete her degree in Business Administration at the Universidad Pública del Valle.  She did this thanks to a full scholarship that she got from the state of Colombia.  She received the scholarship because of her academic excellence and because her family has a very low level of income.

Indira Melissa's dream is to get a Master’s Degree in the United Kingdom.  The support from Kiva would help Indira Melissa be able to pay for the TOEFL preparation courses and the exam registration fees.

Once she gets her Master’s Degree and returns to Colombia, Indira Melissa would like to devote herself to research and teaching at a public university, where she would be able to share her acquired knowledge.

Here is her story:

I am aware that studying for a Master’s Degree in management and implementation of development projects in one of the best universities in the world cannot be for selfish reasons.  It is gratifying for me to know that this is a dream that is not only for my own benefit, but that by doing this I will be able to be useful to my region, to my country, in academia, and, above all, to tomorrow’s young people.  That is precisely my vision for the future.  It is a reality in which the work makes sense only when it contributes to the common good.

Being one of Kiva’s borrowers would resolve one more of the many obstacles that I have already overcome and those that will come.  Also, it is above all an incentive, a confirmation that nothing is able to come between your vision, your dream, and yourself.  

This is because, of the few reasons that could be considered for not completing the post graduate studies, the lack of financial resources is definitely the last that would be accepted as a roadblock to my dream.

This is no more than my firm conviction about effort.  As Gandhi said so well, “Our reward is found in the effort, not in the result.  A complete effort is a complete victory.”

loans.use: to help pay for the application expenses for studying for a Master's Degree in Implementing Development Projects.

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
La socia Bertha tiene 22 años y tiene una relación de unión libre pero esta embarazada y tiene seis meses de gestación, ella es natural de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo pero ahora vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco. La socia Bertha es una joven emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los restos pues tiene un puesto de venta de libros. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Bertha requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo libros (La socia que Bertha está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Amigos Emprendedores” en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de libros en su mayoría, venta de dulces y otros brindan servicio de taxi.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las personas que a perecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión del banco comunal). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
One of the members of the group is 22-year old Bertha who is 6-months pregnant and is in a common-law relationship. She was born in the town of Ollyantaytambo but now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Bertha is a hardworking and responsible young woman who enjoys looking at archeological remains.
