Ninfa has been farming corn and rice for ten years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  She requests the loan to work in agriculture and to buy farm supplies.  With help from the loan she will buy supplies.  Her dream is to own a parcel of land.  She’s had no type of problem with her crops.  In her free time she enjoys swimming.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Santo Domingo” y las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta  en el distrito del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. La socia Maria Elena, tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación dos hijos. La socia Maria Elena nació en la ciudad de Espinar  pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia Maria Elena alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella sigue sembrando manzanas y frejoles para luego los vende al por mayor en los diferentes mercados. Además, ella también se está dedicando a brindar servicio de movilidad escolar de un colegio particular. Su anhelo de la socia Maria Elena es comprarse un carro un nuevo.  

En esta oportunidad la socia Maria Elena solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. La socia Maria Elena está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María Elena continues as a member of the “Santo Domingo” communal bank.  The bank meets every thirty days in Cusco District in Cusco Province and Department.  María Elena is 42-years-old, married and has two children.  She was born in the city of Espinar but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.

She alternates her daily activities with the business of agriculture.  She continues growing apples and broad beans to then sell at wholesale in various markets.  She also working providing school transportation services.  Her wish is to buy a new car.

On this occasion, María Elena is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yanet Luisa

texts.es:
Yanet sigue siendo miembro del banco comunal Santo Domingo, ella tiene 44 años de edad y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 14 años, Yanet ha trabajado en un salón de belleza, donde ella sigue haciendo cortes de cabello y otros servicios que le piden sus clientes.   

En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para poner a pagar la educación de sus hijos y para implementar el salón desea comprar tintes y champús. El sueño de la socia Yanet es que sus dos hijos mayores que han estudiando enfermería y contabilidad sigan una especialización.
texts.en:
Yanet is still a member of the communal bank Santo Domingo. She is 44 years old and has three children. She has been working in a beauty salon for fourteen years, and she still gives haircuts there, as well as other services her customers request.

This time Yanet needs the loan in order to pay for her children's education and to stock up on dyes and shampoo for the salon. 

Member Yanet's dream is for each of her two oldest children, who have studied nursing and accounting, to pursue a specialization.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education and purchase dyes and shampoo for the hair salon where she works.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena sigue siendo miembro del Banco comunal “Santo Domingo”. Ella tiene 49 años y está separada de su pareja pero, vive con sus tres hijos. María Elena tiene un restaurante en el  distrito popular de Santiago de la ciudad de Cusco. Ella ha tenido el restaurante por 20 años y le va muy bien, ella en el local sirve una variedad de platos de comida como por ejemplo sopas, desayunos y almuerzo diario por 3 soles. 

En esta oportunidad Maria Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para preparar las comidas como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, huevos,  aceite y carne. Su anhelo para el futuro es tener un gran restaurante de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Maria Elena continues being a member of the community bank "Santo Domingo".  She is 49 years old, separated, and lives with her three children.  Maria Elena has a restaurant in the popular district of Santiago of the city of Cusco.  She has had the restaurant for 20 years and it is doing well.  She serves a variety of food such as soups, daily breakfasts and lunches for 3 soles.

At this time, Maria Elena needs a loan to buy ingredients for her food preparation, such as sacks of rice, eggs, oil and meats.  He goal for the future is to own a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, sodas, and beer in bulk.

loans.name: Erdenemunh

texts.en: Mr. Erdenemunh, who is 35 years old, lives with a his wife and two sons in a ger in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Uvurhangai province is one of the leading organic dairy producers in Mongolia. He has been producing organic dairy products since 2010, which he sells in the center of the province and Ulaanbaatar city.  When he bought two cows in 2010, his yield of organic milk products was increased. He also has over 40 goats. Now Mr. Erdenemunh is requesting MNT 4,000,000 to purchase four good breed cows. With this purchase it will be possible to produce many additional kinds of organic dairy products. He is an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase four good breed cows

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Romel has a sugarcane field that harvests and sells sugarcane during harvest time He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the farm.

Romel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Romel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлане 57 лет, вдова, имеет дочь. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Светлана в 2000 году начала свой бизнес в торговле детской одеждой  со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду,  Светлана сумела увеличить товарооборот, получая прибыль за месяц в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Светлана  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку партии детской обуви на осенний сезон.  Доходы от кредита Светлана планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, а также планирует сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Svetlana is 57 years old, a widow and has a daughter.  In search of a source of income for her family, Svetlana started her own business in sales of children's clothing in 2000 with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she was able to increase her goods turnover, making a monthly profit of 8,000 som (KGS).  Today, the merchandise selection is limited and this is why Svetlana requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase an inventory of children's shoes for the autumn season.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into business development and also plans to make repairs at home.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of children's shoes for the autumn season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to grow plants.

loans.name: Cecilia Gladys

texts.es:
Cecilia tiene 54 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 35, 32 y 24 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Cecilia se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 20 años.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando en la siembra y compra de abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar los insumos a tiempo.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de visita donde los familiares.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 54, is in a common law relationship and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 35, 32 and 24 years of age in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Las Palmas” communal bank located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they work in agriculture.

Cecilia has been growing corn and rice for 20 years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  She’s asking for the loan to continue working in agriculture and to buy manure.  With help from the loan she will buy supplies in time.  She’s had no type of problem and enjoys visiting relatives in her free time.

loans.use: to continue working in farming and to buy manure.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es: María, habitante de la ciudad de Granada , nos expresa su agradecimiento por haber sido beneficiada con un préstamo Kiva el cual le ayuda a comprara más productos de belleza para vender ,pues su negocio necesita surtir de variedad productos de uso personal. A ella le gusto mucho la experiencia de recibir el préstamo pues se sintió respaldada. Ahora ella solicita un crédito para comprar productos para el cabello, sombrillas, cosméticos variados. Pues entre mas variedad ofrezca atraerá más clientes y mejorara lo ingresos para hacer mas productivo su negocio.
texts.en: María lives in the city of Granda.  She tells us that she is very thankful to receive this Kiva loan which will help her buy more beauty products to sell.  Her business needs more stock in a variety of personal products.  She is very happy to receive this loan and feels supported.  She is seeking a loan to buy hair care products, umbrellas, and various cosmetics.  If she offers a bigger selection, she will attract more clients and increase her income so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, umbrellas, and various cosmetics.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед проживает в городе Куляб. Он женат. Ему 46 лет. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, дети маленькие. Хуршед имеет средне - специальное образование. Он окончил медицинский колледж. По специальности Хуршед не работает. 
Уже шесть месяцев как Хуршед занимается своим бизнесом. Он открыл магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Хуршед занимается торговлей фруктов, продуктов питания, кондитерских изделий и хозяйственных товаров. Он просит кредит для покупки выше перечисленных товаров с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 46 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker, and children are small.  Khurshed has a secondary-specialized education.  He graduated from a medical college.  Khurshed does not work in his field.  He has been involved in a business for six months.  He opened a store with a mixed selection of merchandise.  Khurshed sells fruits, food products, confectionery goods and household products.  He is requesting this loan to purchase the above-mentioned products in order to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase products in order to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Karina Maricela

texts.es:
Karina, soltera de 20 años vive en la ciudad de Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi. Latacunga se ubica a 2750 metros sobre el nivel del mar y está en las faldas de la cordillera de los Andes, a pocos kilómetros  del Cotopaxi, el volcán activo más alto del mundo. En los últimos años, Latacunga ha alcanzado un importante desarrollo, lo que le ubica entre las ciudades más importantes de la sierra norte. 
Latacunga se sustenta de manera económica fundamentalmente de agricultura, ganadería y comercio. Otro dato interesante es que debido a su riqueza cultural, arquitectónica y histórica, ha pasado a ser patrimonio nacional.
Karina vive con su padre y madre, ella se dedica a la venta de víveres un negocio que aprendió de sus padres. Actualmente trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y lo hace sin recibir ayuda. Ello solicita un crédito para poder comprar mayor volumen de víveres y así vender a un mayor mercado. Si logra esto podrá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. El sueño de Karina es terminar su carrera profesional, este préstamo resulta parte fundamental para poder alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en: Karina is single and twenty. She lives in the town of Latacunga, in the province of Cotopaxi. Latacunga is located 2,750 metres above sea level, in the Andes, a few kilometres from Cotopaxi, the most active volcano in the world. These past few years, Latacunga has been steadily growing until it became one of the most important cities of the north face of the mountain range. Latacunga's primary activities are agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce. It has also become a national heritage site thanks to its cultural, architectural, and historical significance. Karina lives with her parents, she sells food, a trade she learned from them. She works about eight hours a day, alone. She asks for a loan to buy a greater supply of food and thus sell to more customers. If she manages that, she will improve her income and her quality of life. Karina's dream is to finish her studies, this loan is an essential step towards accomplishing her goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Hernando Gabriel

texts.es: Hernando de 37 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 meses a 8 años. En 5 años de experiencia en su restaurante,  ha logrado generar ingresos para aumentar cada vez mas el  bienestar de su hogar; él observando la oportunidad de vender alimentos,  pues no existía competencia alguna en el sector y aprovechando la buena  sazón cartagenera con la cual su madre los elabora, decidió emprender una aventura de negocios en el cual le ha ido muy bien y hoy es muy reconocido en el sector. Los platos preferidos de su clientela son exactamente los que vende, pues se enmarca en los requerimientos de sus compradores diarios, que son empleados de construcción peatones y vecinos del barrio y usualmente solicitan el deliciosos sancochos trifásicos, que es su producto estrella, así mismo vende desayunos, pasabocas, congelados y pasteles (amasijos de arroz con carne y/o pollo y/o cerdo, verduras, cocidos envueltos en hojas de bijao y atados con icos )  El incremento de sus clientes es cada vez mayor, así su capital de trabajo usual no es suficiente para hacer compras en mayor volumen, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos y materias primas, para aumentar el volumen de su oferta; además comprará una vitrina calentadora y una carpa, para protegerse del incesante sol del Caribe y de la lluvia, además de brindar un ambiente mas confortable a su  clientela cuando estos llegan a su negocio, porque ella es justamente la razón de ser de su negocio. .
texts.en:
Hernando, 37, lives with his spouse and three children whose ages range from three months to 8 years.  In his five years’ experience working in his restaurant he’s managed to generate income to improve his home’s wellbeing all the time.  Because there was no competition in his area selling food he noticed that this was an opportunity for him and taking advantage of the tasty way his mother prepares food he decided on a business venture that he’s done quite well in;  today, he’s very well known in the sector.

His clientele’s favorite dishes are precisely the ones he sells.  He customizes his offers to his customers’ daily preferences.  His usual customers are construction workers, passersby and local neighbors who request the delicious “sancochos trifásicos” [stew made with three different kinds of meat] which is his star item.  He also sells breakfasts, snacks, frozen treats and “pasteles” (rice-based dough filled with meat and/or chicken and/or pork and vegetables cooked wrapped in tied bijao leaves).

His clientele grows more every day so his usual working capital is insufficient to buy in volume which is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy supplies and raw materials to increase his volume of products.  He will also buy a heating display case and a tent to protect from the incessant Caribbean heat and rain and provide a more comfortable environment for his customers when then come to his business which is his business’ reason for being.

loans.use: to buy supplies, raw materials, a heating display case and a tent.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina  de 66 años de edad, vive en uno de los barrios mas tradicionales de Cartagena  de Indias, llamada también la ciudad heroica, donde el folclor y el ambiente Caribe, se hacen mas notorio entre sus habitantes. Desde sus 20 años se dedicó al comercio, actividad que hoy también desarrolla y con la que sacó adelante a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 8 hijos. Hoy en un local comercial distribuye refrescos y bebidas como cervezas, poni malta y gaseosas. Sus ventas las realiza al por mayor  durante todo el día y  toda la semana, pero con mayor intensidad de viernes a domingos. Sus clientes son vecinos del sector, propietarios de tiendas y estancos, que le compran de contado y que hacen sus pedidos previamente. Actualmente la demanda se incrementa, especialmente en el segundo semestre del año, porque se avecinan muchos días festivos y fiestas patronales, de esta manera su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para hacer sus compras. Esta es la razón por lo cual accede a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará en un mayor volumen bebidas y refrescos que el acostumbrado, para tener un stock de productos disponibles y así cuando lo requieran sus clientes, darles una respuesta inmediata. Su meta más adelante, es adicionar otras líneas de bebidas, como Whisky para captar la atención de otro perfil de cliente y aumentar el porcentaje de rentabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 66 years old and she lives in one of the more traditional neighborhoods of Cartagena de Indias, also known as the heroic city where the folklore and Caribbean environment make the locals notorious.  For the past 20 years she has been a salesperson, an activity that today she continues and one that has helped her family, composed of her husband and 8 children, to get ahead.  

She is a commercial distributor and sells refreshments and soft drinks such as beer, Pony Malta (a non-alcoholic soft drink), and other soft drinks.  She sells her beverages every day during the week, but with most of her sales occurring between Fridays and Sundays.  Her customers are neighbors from the area that are owners of shops and food stalls.  They pay in cash and place their orders in advance.

Demand for her beverages has increased, especially in the second half of the year because there are lots of festivals and government holidays.  Because of this, her capital is insufficient to buy supplies.  This is the reason that she is seeking a loan from Kiva, with which she will buy beverages and refreshments in bulk so that she has a large stock of available products, and when her clients require more stock, she can fulfill their order immediately.

Her future goal is to add more types of drinks, such as Whisky so that she can capture the attention of peripheral clients and increase the percentage of profitability in her business.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of drinks and refreshments.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es: Carlos, habita en la ciudad de Granada, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, padre de familia. Su primer préstamo lo utilizo para comprar frutas y verduras para surtir su pequeño negocio logro vender productos de la temporada, mejoraron sus ventas y sus ingresos. El quiere seguir avanzando, creciendo como comerciante dando a conocer más sus frutas y hortalizas. El está requiriendo el crédito para comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor, esto le permitirá satisfacer parte de la demanda actual que tiene de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en: Carlos lives in the city of Granada.  He sells fruits and vegetables.  He is a father.  He used his first loan to buy fruits and vegetables to stock his small business.  He also sells seasonal products which improves his sales and his income.  He wants to continue advancing and growing as a salesperson and he wants to be known as the person that knows the most about fruits and vegetables.  He needs a loan so that he can buy fruit and vegetables in bulk.  This will enable him to satisfy the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Shirinmo

texts.ru: Ширинмо жительница города Куляб. Ей 53 года. Она вдова. Живет с дочерью. Ширинмо вместе с дочерью работает на рынке. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности Ширинмо занимается шесть лет. Ширинмо просит кредит для покупки сезонной детской одежды. Ширинмо будет очень рада если вы поможете ей.
texts.en: Shirinmo is a resident of the city of Kulob.  She is 53 years old, a widow and lives with her daughter.  Shirinmo and her daughter work at a market.  She is involved in selling children's clothing.  Shirinmo has been in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal children's clothing.  Shirinmo will be very happy if you would help her.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's clothing

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia de 44 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 17 a 23 años, en Puerto Colombia, un municipio de terreno plano y ondulado de clima cálido y un hermoso ambiente de playa brisa y mar; Allí tiene una miscelánea donde exhibe artículos de perfumería, calzado, ropa y accesorios en general, que forman parte de la respuesta que ella da a la clientela que por allí pasa, alrededor  a sus intereses y necesidades. Eufemia realiza las venta de contado en su miscelánea, pero también en su oferta maneja el crédito con clientes especiales, en lo relacionado con electrodomésticos menores, como licuadoras, abanicos, ollas,  sanducheras etc. Su clientela está conformada por habitantes del pueblo principalmente quienes la identifican y hacen sus compras en la miscelánea.  Eufemia es una mujer muy trabajadora, por eso con el fin de lograr ingresos que beneficien su hogar y como es consciente de las oportunidades,  también trabaja parte de su tiempo en un restaurante de comida especializada  en carnes y pescado, delegando así las tareas comerciales a su hija menor, quien la apoya en su negocio. Su meta es continuar ampliando su miscelánea y mas adelante abrir al público su propio restaurante, pues no desaprovechará esta experiencia para ponerla al servicio de su potencial mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía variada para aumentar el surtido de ropa y accesorios y ofrecer una respuesta muy oportuna a su clientela pues a ella se debe su crecimiento, en el que rota sus inventarios cada 32 días y maneja un margen de rentabilidad promedia del 32%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Eufemia is 44 years old and lives with her spouse and their three children, whose ages are between 17 and 23, in Puerto Colombia. This town has flat and undulating terrain, warm weather, and a beautiful breezy atmosphere from the beach and the ocean.

She has a retail store there, where she offers toiletries, shoes, clothing, and accessories in general, in response to the interests and needs of passing-by customers. Eufemia charges cash at her store, but she also manages credit with special customers regarding the sale of small appliances like blenders, fans, slow cookers, sandwich makers, etc. Her customer base is made up mainly of local residents, who know her and do their shopping at her store.

Eufemia is a very hard worker. In order to obtain income to benefit her home and because she is aware of any opportunities, she also works part-time at a restaurant specializing in meat and fish. In the meantime, she delegates her sales work to her youngest daughter, who helps her with her business. Her goal is to continue expanding her store. In the future, she would like to make the most of her experience by using it to figure out potential markets and open her own restaurant to the public. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, requesting financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the first time. She will use it to purchase assorted merchandise so that she can increase her stock of clothing and accessories and offer her customers a tailored response, because after all, she ows her growth to them. She rotates inventory every 32 days and her average profit margin is 32%, which is the financial indicator on which we base her growth projection.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is 23 years old and from Gaza. Since 2011, he has owned and operated a grocery store. He has one employee. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an air conditioner, display shelves, and new decor for the store. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and thus make him closer to reaching his ambition of getting married and having a big family.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, display shelves, and decor for his store.

loans.name: Noufa

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Noufa prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Noufa is a 35-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan who has four family members. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements, specifically maintenance and painting. In the future she hopes to increase the number of rooms in her home and help her children become educated.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Rahmatsho

texts.ru:
Рахматшо проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена и дочь Рахматшо занимаются домашним хозяйством. Его сын находится на заработках за рубежом. Сам Рахматшо имеет высшее неоконченное образование. Он более двенадцати лет занимается производством чугунных печек. В этой области Рахматшо имеет богатый опыт. 
Рахматшо просит кредит для покупки материалов, чтобы производит печки для торговли.
texts.en: Rahmatsho lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 52 years old, married and has two children.  His wife and daughter are involved in household work, and son is working abroad.  Rahmatsho has an incomplete higher education.  He has been involved in manufacturing cast iron ovens for over twelve years.  Rahmatsho has a rich experience in this field.  He is requesting this loan to purchase materials in order to make ovens for sale.

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to make ovens for sale

loans.name: Saodatmo

texts.ru:
Саодатмо родилась 1988 году. Она проживает в городе Куляб. Саодатмо одинокая мать двоих детей. Она живет с родителями. У нее двое маленьких детей. 
Саодатмо имеет торговую точку на рынке города Куляб, где она занимается продажей тканей. Торговлей она занимается десять лет. Саодатмо просит кредит для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Saodatmo was born in 1988.  She lives in the city of Kulob.  Saodatmo is a single mother of two children.  She lives with her parents and has two small children.  Saodatmo has a retail outlet at a market in the city of Kulob, where she sells fabrics.  She has been involved in sales for ten years.  Saodatmo is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca, tiene 61 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Tela, junto a dos estudiantes que cuida. Doña Francisca tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la floristería y venta de cosméticos. Elabora piñatas, arreglos florales y vende cremas, lociones, perfumes, desodorantes y otros productos de belleza y cosméticos, por medio de catálogos de AVON y VOGUE. Además cuida a dos estudiantes de donde obtiene otros ingresos. Esta solicitando el tercer préstamo a ODEF, que es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar materiales como papel china, alambre, pegamento para la elaboración de piñatas que tiene por encargo actualmente y cumplirles a sus clientes. Su meta es hacer crecer más su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Francisca, 61, is single and has a son.  She lives in the town of Tela with two students she cares for.  Francisca has been working as a florist and selling cosmetics for 20 years.  She manufactures piñatas, floral arrangements and sells creams, lotions, perfume, deodorant and other beauty products and cosmetics via Avon and Vogue catalogues.  She also cares for two students earing extra income that way.  She’s asking for her third ODEF loan for 15,000 Lempiras to buy supplies like crepe paper, wire and glue to make piñatas because she has pending customer orders she wants to fill.  Her goal is to grow more in her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy crepe paper, glue and wire to make piñatas to sell.

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es: YYenis de 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y es la propietaria de una comercializadora dedicada a la venta de pescado y frutas, que inició una vez su esposo le dio el primer capital semilla,  lo aprovechó inmediatamente y con su disciplina lo hizo crecer. Con su negocio Yenis se siente agradecida, porque ha logrado genera ingresos que contribuyen al bienestar de su familia. Aun así su mayor desafío es tener el capital suficiente para lograr su meta de crecimiento, pues mas adelante sueña con tener un local donde expender   todo tipo de carnes de res, pesado, pollo etc. En la actualidad Yenis está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pescado fresco, refrescos y  frutas, compra que hará en el marco de la rotación de cada producto Yenis maneja unos indicadores financieros ajustados a su tipo de negocio pues rota su mercancía cada 3 días, mientras su rentabilidad promedia sobre las ventas es de 7,4% y un endeudamiento futuro, con su crédito  de 35,6%, negocio que muestra un potencial importante de crecimiento, desde el cual proyectamos la inversión de su credikiva y auguramos muchos éxitos en ella porque conoce el mercado ampliará su clientela y conseguirá descuentos por compras de contado y en mayor volumen, para ser trasladadas a sus utilidades..
texts.en:
Yenis, 28, lives in the city of Cartagena and owns a shop where she sells fruit and fish that she started when her husband gave her her initial seed funds.  She took advantage of it immediately and with her discipline made it grow.  Yenis feels grateful for her business because she’s managed to generate income that contributes to her family’s wellbeing.  Even so her greatest challenge is having sufficient capital to reach her growth objective because later on she’s like to have a locale where she can expand into all types of meat, fish, chicken, etc.

Yenis is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy fresh fish, soft-drinks and fruit.  She will buy these to replenish the goods she sells.  Yenis’ financial indicators adjusted for this type of business are a three-day stock turnover and an average profit margin of 7.4%; her future debt with her loan is 35.6%.  Her business has important growth potential which is why the investment of her Kiva loan should be successful; she knows her market well and customer base should grow.  In addition, she’ll qualify for volume purchase discounts which will transfer into higher profits.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, soft-drinks and fruit.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria, dueña de una pulpería, originaria de Granada. Obtuvo su primer  crédito con MiCredito, el cual utilizo para surtir su pequeña pulpería, el haber sido beneficiada con el crédito Kiva, le ayudo mejorar sus ingresos y surtir su negocio. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad brindada. Ahora ella solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, aceite, enlatados, azúcar, productos de limpieza. Ya que son parte de los productos que más le solicitan sus clientes y debe tener en inventario para vender, pues desea que su pulpería crezca día a día , así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria owns a grocery store.  She’s from Granada.  She got her first loan from MiCredito that she used to stock her small grocery store.  Having been benefited by Kiva she was able to improve her income and stock her store.  She’s grateful for the opportunity provided.  Now, she’s requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil, canned goods, sugar and cleaning supplies to sell because they are among the items most requested by her customers.  She wants her grocery store to grow more every day thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on beverages for her bar.

loans.name: Nellys

texts.es: Nellys de 38 años de edad  es madre de 2 niños en las edades de 17 y 8 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas en un futuro, por eso trabaja diariamente con mucho esmero con el fin de lograrlo. Ella tiene un pequeño taller donde elabora bolsos y sandalias artesanales, actividad que aprendió y que le ha servido como generadora de ingresos,  pues como mujer cabeza de familia es responsable del bienestar de sus hijos. Su meta es tener una gran empresa y poco a poco se preparará para ello, porque es su gran sueño de prosperidad. Sus productos son elaborados en cuero tex, cuerina, entre otros materiales;  sus clientes están ubicados en las ciudades de Barranquilla  y de Cartagena y permanentemente hacen pedidos, que no toda las veces puede cumplir,  pues su desafío es el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta,  con el que no alcanza a    responder a su demanda. Su experiencia data desde hace 5 años,  cuando se preparó para dirigir ella sola su hogar;  en la actualidad vende mediante un catalogo propio,  a partir del cual le encargan y ella los vende a crédito. Hoy se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, con el comprará materias primas e insumos, para fabricar nuevos diseños de sandalias y bolsos, que tiene encargados por distribuidores en la ciudad de Barranquilla y por parte de su vecinos que son la voz de su promoción.
texts.en:
Nellys, 38, is the mother of two children who are 17 and 8 years old. She dreams with seeing them become successful people in the future which is why she works hard every day.  She has a small workshop where she manufactures purses and sandals artisanally, an activity she learned and that has served as her source of income because as a female head of household she is responsible for her children’s wellbeing.  Her goal is to have a great firm and is gradually preparing for it because her great dream is one of prosperity.

She manufactures her products out of faux leather and Naugahyde, among others.  Her customers are in Barranquilla and Cartagena and place regular orders that she sometimes is unable to fill because her challenge is lack of working capital that keeps her from being able to meet demand.  

She has five years’ experience when she took on the responsibility for her home by herself.  She currently sells via her own catalogue which is how orders are placed; she sells on credit.

Today, she’s approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies to manufacture new designs of sandals and purses that suppliers in the city of Barranquilla have ordered from her as well as from some of her neighbors who are her main promoters.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture new designs of sandals and purses.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es:
La socia Ana María tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad de Urubamba. La socia Ana María es ama de casa, ella es una mujer muy alegre y responsable que alterna sus actividades del hogar con las del negocio. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Ana María  es la venta de verduras entonces tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Ana María requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cebolla, zanahoria, papas, maíz y otras más. (La socia Ana María está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “El Buen Samaritano” en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de utensilios, venta de verduras, preparación de jugos naturales, venta de comida, elaboración y venta de artesanía y otros brindan servicio de costura y cocina. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  She is a native of the city of Cusco, but she lives in the beautiful city of Urubamba.  Ana Maria is a housewife who is very happy and responsible.  She alternates her household activities with her work in her business.  She has a business selling vegetables from a stand in one of the most popular markets in the city of Urubamba.  She has already had this business for 4 years, and it is going very well.  At this time, Ana Maria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as: onions, carrots, potatoes, corn and other products.  In the picture, Ana Maria is the one waving her hand.

This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the communal bank " El Buen Samaritano" in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  Each of the members of this group is always seeking opportunities to get ahead.  With their daily efforts they are providing a better future for their children.  They have a variety of businesses, including: the sale of utensils, the sale of vegetables, the preparation of natural juices, the sale of food, and the production and sale of handicrafts.  Other members provide sewing and cooking services.

The members of this group appreciate the opportunity that they are being provided, and they are committed to making the various payments according to their individual  loan schedules. 

Cusco is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  It is the heart of the ancient city of the Inkas, and is known for being a tourist area with archeological centers, an historic central plaza, and beautiful countrysides.  Cusco is known for its history, and for being an enchanting city in the southern part of the country.  Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and for being the gateway to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots, potatoes, corn and other products

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Nelly compró mucha mercancia que vendió, recuperó la invesión y ganó dinero. Ella está muy satisfecha y entusiasmada con su credikiva, por lo cual está aplicando a un nuevo credito, con el que comprará nuevamente mercancia, pero ajustada a la temporada a propósito de la celebración del dia del amor y de la amistad, por eso invertirá en detalles femeninos, rosas, boligrafos, accesorios de hogar, ropa calzado y perfume, además de sus fabulosos y frios refrescos y bebidas. Su inversión tendrá éxito en tanto está invirtiendo en una época, en la cual su negocio incrementa sus venta y es una de las buenas temporadas del año para el comercio. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Felicitaciones sigagannos apoyando, porque necesitamos personas como ustedes."
texts.en: Nelly used her previous Kiva loan to buy much merchandise that she sold.  She recovered her investment and earned money.  She’s very satisfied with and excited about the new Kiva loan that she’s applying for that she’ll use to once again buy merchandise adjusted to the season.  Because the Day of Love and Friendship is approaching she will buy women’s accessories, roses, pens, items for the home, clothes, shoes and perfume in addition to her fabulous, cold beverages and soft-drinks.  Her investment will be successful in that she’s investing in a season in which business increases and this is one of the year’s best seasons for commerce.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Congratulations.  Continue supporting us because we need people like you.”

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, roses, pens, home items, clothes, shoes and perfume.

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn is a newly recognized member of PMPC. She is 44 years old and married with three adult children. Marelyn has been selling gasoline for nine years with average monthly earnings of 3,000 Philippine pesos. 

Marilyn decided to be part of PMPC to have financial access to support her business. She took out a loan with PMPC to purchase additional stock of gasoline to sell. She is hoping to increase her monthly income to meet family needs and to save some money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jugs of refined palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for improvements to his restaurant.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane runs a little booth, where she sells fruits and vegetables. Gayane started this business in 2009. Now Gayane needs some investments to add more produce. In particular, she plans to purchase walnuts and garlic. This will allow Gayane to be competitive in the market and attract more customers.
 
Gayane lives with her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and little grandchild. Development of the business is important for her to earn sufficient income and sustain the family.

loans.use: to pay for walnuts and garlic.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una abarrotería, habitante de la ciudad de Granada. Fue beneficiada con un crédito, el cual utilizo para invertir en compras de productos comestibles, esto le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos, de las ganancias ha ido pagando los estudios de su hijo. Esta agradecida por el apoyo a su negocio. En esta ocasión está requiriendo un crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite al por mayor. De esta manera podrá conseguirlo más barato y vender a un precio más accesibles a sus clientes que a diario le solicitan estos productos.
texts.en:
Martha, a merchant, is the owner of a grocery story. She lives in the city of Granada. 

She was granted a previous loan, which she used to buy edible products. This helped her to improve her income. With the profits she has been paying for her child’s education. She is grateful for the support of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, and oil mostly. The loan will allow her to purchase the goods at a cheaper price and sell them to her clients at an affordable price. Her clients ask daily for these products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single woman. She describes herself to be an diligent and ambitious woman.  She operates a restaurant where she sells soft drinks. Her business is located within a busy environment and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. 

Sarah will use th KES 20,000 loan to to buy soft drinks to resell. Her business goal is to run a bigger restaurant and hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she can buy a van for venturing into a new business of providing transportation services to customers.

loans.use: buy soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en: Avetik lives in Vernashen village with his parents.  He serves in the local military unit. In addition, he helps his parents to run the family farm where they raise cows, hens and grow fruit trees. Avetik would like to purchase one more calf for the farm, as well as buy grass to feed the cattle during winter. This will help Avetik to keep a stable development of the farm and continue its expansion.

loans.use: buy a calf and cattle feed

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a 39-year-old widowed woman.  She has 3 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be a very ambitious woman.  She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes.   Magdalene has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a potential business environment.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for selling a wide variety types of clothes. 

Magdalene will use this KES 20,000 loan to to buy two bales of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to run many such similar retail stalls within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy two bales of trousers

loans.name: Aderine

texts.en: Adeline 20 years old. She is married to a businessman. She owns a boutique where she has different items that she sells. Adeline has been running the business for four years. She wants the loan to buy more rice, salt, and cooking oil to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy rice, salt and cooking oil to resell

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a businesswoman who runs a firewood selling business in the town of Msambweni, Kenya.  She has had her business for around eight years. After successfully repaying her previous loans, she is ready for another one and will invest it all in her business, which she started with her little savings before taking out her first loan.  

Mwanakame  is dedicated to her business since it is her only source of livelihood, apart from the little income from her spouse who is a fisherman.   Mwanakame will use this loan to expand her business inventory by purchasing more firewood for sale. 

Mwanakame lives with her long-term partner and their six children. She said her most difficult challenge is to thrive with her business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Sivia

texts.en:
Sivia is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sivia has been working hard to manage his stationery business, which does printing, binding and book selling.

To help expand his business, Sivia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a computer and other more stationery materials like books and a binding machine, and will help Sivia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  Sivia hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger and well-stocked stationery shop. 

Sivia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sivia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy a computer, books and a binding machine

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in Vernashen village with her father and brother. Anna's brother works at a local factory, and helps Anna and their father to run the farm where they raise cattle and grow fruit trees. Anna has applied for this loan to purchase one more calf for the farm. In addition, she wants to purchase forage to feed the cattle during winter. These purchases will allow Anna to keep gathering a stable income from agriculture and invest in its further development.

loans.use: buy a calf and forage

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Berard

texts.en:
Berard is a 35-year-old married man.  He has 5 children. He describes himself to be self-motivated man.  He operates a food stall  where he sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a potential business area.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of cereals. 

Berard will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ten bags of maize.  His business goal is to be a large supplier of maize within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be a successful businessman.  Berard also does farming, which increases his business income. This is his first loan.

loans.use: buy ten bags of maize

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has 4 children.  Conchita  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Conchita requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Conchita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Wafa'a

texts.en:
Wafa'a is a 21-year-old single woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy clothes and blankets to resell.  She wants to sell her products to her friends and neighbors.  Also, she would like to expand her project by increase her products. In the future she hopes to increase her family's income.

Since Wafa'a is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: buy clothes and blankets to resell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 27 years old, and married with two children, both of whom are minors. She lives in Bino-ongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  Cheryl has operated an existing snack making and selling business for a period of three years, earning PHP 2,500 per month. She decided to be a member of PMPC this year to have financial access to support her business.  Aside from selling snacks, she started raising pigs to increase the household income.  She took a loan in PMPC to purchase feed for the raised piglets. She wants to used the profit to feed her children.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 50 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a teacher and brings in additional income to sustain the family. Jane runs a boutique shop in Kapsabet, a business which has been in operation for five years, earning Kenya shillings 30,000 monthly. 

This is her second loan with KADET Ltd, after successfully repaying her previous loan, and she plans to use the loan to purchase new clothes for resale. 

She hopes that her business prospers so as to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en: Cherlita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Cherlita has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store), where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale. Cherlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Daysi Auxiliadora

texts.es: Daysi de 29 años de edad, originaria de Granada, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, ella es comerciante, propietaria de una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio a la edad de 27 años con el apoyo de su esposo, quien aporto económicamente. Ella comercializa sus productos de pulpería en su casa de habitación. Se siente satisfecha en el lugar donde comercializa por la preferencia de sus clientes y como expectativa tiene seguir creciendo en su negocio, el cual le permita la sostenibilidad económica de los futuros estudios de su pequeño hijo. Solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar materiales de construccion y  construir un pequeño cuarto para ubicar su pulpería en un lugar más cómodo  ya que la tiene en  la sala de su casa. Ella estima que este crédito va a mejorar las condiciones del negocio ya que ubicara sus productos de pulpería como granos básicos, lácteos, verduras, productos para limpieza del hogar, en el lugar más visible. Una de sus metas es seguir invirtiendo en productos varios con los que no cuenta en estos momentos su negocio y asi poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daysi, 29, is originally from Granada and has a 2-year old son. She is a merchant and is the owner of a small grocery store. She started this business when she was 27 years old with the support of her husband, who contributed financially. She sells her products from her small store from her home in which she lives. She is satisfied with her business location because of her customers’ preferences and as she expected, she will continue to grow her business which will allow her to financially support schooling for her young son in the future. 

She is requesting this loan with the goal of buying construction supplies and building a small room in order to move her grocery store to a more comfortable location because currently, it is located in her living room. She believes this loan will improve her business’ condition because she will position her grocery store products, such as grains, dairy, vegetables, and cleaning products, in a more visible location. 

One of her goals is to continue investing in a variety of products which she does not have right now and in this way, be able to satisfy her customer’s demands.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies in order to relocate her business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 22 years old and from Gaza. He owns a small shop selling all kinds of fresh juices in an area where there is no other shop that does the same. Ahmad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a display refrigerator and an ice maker refrigerator. He hopes that this youth loan will increase his customers and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and an ice maker refrigerator

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 37-year-old married woman who has four family members and lives in Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for food items to sell in her market. She would like to expand her business by opening another big market. In the future she hopes to buy a car and to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for food items to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a young entrepreneur who is married and has two children. In order to contribute economically to her household, she runs a food stall, where she sells a variety of food, such as dumplings, beans, rice, etc. Now that she is married, her stall still provides economic support for her family, and also allows her to contribute, along with her husband, to her children's education. In an effort to offer a wider variety of foods to her customers, and taking advantage of this festive season, Mwanamisi is requesting a loan to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

Her greatest dream is that through her business she can continue offering her family economic stability, as well as providing good quality services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mariana Mercedes

texts.es:
Mariana Mercedes tiene 40 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Mariana Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas cada mes.

Solicita el crédito para comprar de semillas, urea, fertilizantes. ranger y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para cubrir gastos de la familia. El sueño es contar siempre con buena salud para poder trabajar.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Mariana Mercedes is 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “San Francisco de Sibimbe” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto Sibimbe in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank has 20 members who engage in short-cycle farming. They grow corn and rice.

Mariana Mercedes is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas each month. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), and compost. With the help of this loan, she will be able to cover her family’s expenses. Her dream is to always be in good health and able to work.

In her free time, Mariana Mercedes enjoys reading the Bible.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, herbicide, and compost.

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en: Mr. Gantugs is 32 years old – one of the hardworking guys. He operates a taxi business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2006, he has been running his business nonstop. He lives with his two daughters and his wife in an old house in the ger district – an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. In the winter, his house becomes very cold inside and his daughters always get sick due to feeling cold at home. His house loses too much heat through its old floor. So, Mr. Gantugs decided to get a new wooden floor for his house. He really hopes that his house will be warmer and more comfortable after this. The loan he is requesting will be used to cover the cost of the new wooden floor for his house.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a new wooden floor for his house.

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is 47 years old and is from Gaza. He is married and has four children.

Khader has owned a grocery store since 2005 where he sells food, canned food, detergents, and other items. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more goods for his shop and a new refrigerator.

His ambition is to settle down in his own house since his family lives in the big family's house. He hopes that this loan will help him achieve his ambition by increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his shop and a new refrigerator

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en: Buenaventurada is 57 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are school age.  She's been a member of PMPC since 2010 under the micro-finance program.  She has had a business selling snacks for four years with a monthly income of PHP 1,500.  She took another loan from PMPC to purchase raw materials to make snacks to sell.  She is planning to use the profit to support the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for home improvements

loans.name: Buena Vista Lll Group

texts.es:
El comité Buena Vista 3 esta compuesto por 10 integrantes que son todas vecinas de la misma comunidad. El comité  no tiene mucha experiencia en el  trabajo grupal, ya que es poco el tiempo que trabajan juntas de igual manera  se reunen cada semana para compartir comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo, a resolver sus indiferencias etc. 
Una de las integrantes,la señora Delia se dedica a la venta de chipa y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para seguir produciendo la chica casera, necesita almidón, harina de maíz, leche, huevos, etc para que su producto sea de calidad y muy sabroso.
texts.en:
The committee named “Buena Vista III” consists of 10 members who are all neighbors from the same community. This committee does not have much experience working as a communal group. In the short time they have worked together each week, they have been able to share and communicate with one another so that they can internalize their new responsibilities as a group and resolve their differences.

One of the members is Sra. Delia, who sells “chipa” (cheese bread). With the income she earns, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy necessary ingredients that she needs to continue producing cheese bread such as starch, corn flour, milk, eggs, and other items. These ingredients will help her make a flavorful and high-quality product.

loans.use: to buy starch, corn flour, milk, eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras se encuentra en su noveno ciclo, tiene 12 integrantes, todas ellas muy emprendedoras y agradecidas a la fundación ya que día a día van creciendo tanto personalmente como a nivel laboral.
Laura, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su despensa, desea seguir creciendo a nivel variedad de productos, agrandar su negocio y tener mayores ingresos ya que esta actividad le ayuda a la manutención de su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos lácteos, panificados, frutas,hortalizas, etc y de esta manera poder llegar a cubrir la mayor cantidad de necesidades de su clientela y la suya también.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras [Hard-Working Women] communal bank is in its ninth cycles.  It has 12 members, and all of them are very enterprising.  They are grateful to the Fundación because they are growing every day as much personally as on a work level.

Laura is one of the members of the group.  She sells basic needs products in her small grocery store.  She wishes to continue growing by having a variety of products, making her business bigger, and having greater income.  She wants this because this business activity helps to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy dairy products, baked goods, fruits, and vegetables, etc.  This way she will be able to cover her customers’, and her own, greater quantity of necessities.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, dairy products, and sausages, etc.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is a newly recognized member of PMPC.  She is 55 years old and married with seven adult-age children.  She decided to join PMPC to gain access to financial services for her business.  She has been making and selling snacks for 20 years, and she receives an average monthly income of PHP 2,000.  She out took her first loan from PMPC to purchase additional ingredients to make snacks to sell.  She wants to use the profits to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Clara Irene

texts.es:
La señora Clara es una pequeña comerciante, ubicada en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua.
Ella tiene un local de comidas fritas en el costado norte del mercado municipal de san Rafael del sur, ofrece comidas como enchiladas, tacos nicaragüenses, tajados con queso y con carne, y refrescos naturales.

Su plan de inversión es para ampliar el servicio que ofrece, ya que en estos últimos meses gracias al buen servicio que brinda, ha experimentado que su producto tiene una buena aceptación a los clientes que visitan el mercado municipal.

Anteriormente doña clara producía y vendía tortillas, y ahora gracias a su iniciativa tiene su pequeño negocio personal de comideria donde cree que tiene un gran potencial de crecer como comerciante.
Su estado civil es acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos casados, y dos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Clara has a small business located in the town of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua.

She owns a fried foods stall on the north side of the local market in San Rafael del Sur. She offers dishes such as enchiladas, nicaraguan tacos, fried plantains with cheese or meat, and natural soft drinks.

Her investment plan is to expand the services she offers because, thanks to the good service she provides, in recent months she has seen how her products are well received by the customers who visit the local market.

In the past, Clara made and sold tortillas and now, by her own initiative, she has her own personal small food business where she believes there is great potential for growth.

She lives with her partner and has four children. Two of them are married and the other two are school-age.

loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, pork, and vegetables.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of three boys who are in school. She works every day to be able to fill the role of father and mother for her children.

She opened a food stall, which is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit and there is no doubt that she will meet all of the goals she has set for herself.

With the loan, she wants to buy more ingredients such as baking powder, cooking oil, flour, etc. This will enable her to offer a variety of foods to her customers even as she maximizes profits.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as baking powder, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Maricar has a store that sells used clothes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy used clothes to resell like blouses, pants and skirts.

Maricar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used cloths to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Iman prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Iman is a 34-year-old married woman who supports five family members. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for some home improvements. She will repaint her home and buy new furniture. She hopes to buy a new home in the future.

loans.use: To pay for some home improvements

loans.name: Mouayad

texts.en: Mouayad is a 27-year-old married male, from Ashrafia, Jordan. He has a child. Mouayad requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for his education at university. In the future he wants to continue his higher education. Since Mouayad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his education at university

loans.name: Marie Christine

texts.fr: Marie est une femme commerçante de 29 ans. Elle a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gere depuis 3 ans deja. Son petit commerce fonctionne grace à son acceuiel chaleureux, son experience dans ce domaine lui ont permis d’acquérir et fidéliser une  clientèle  avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, Elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il solicite ce credit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minerale,cartons de sucres, des friandise,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie, age 29, is a merchant. She runs a grocery store that he opened in a district of the capital three years ago. The small business is successful thanks to her warmth, her experience, and her loyal clientele, which is steadily growing. However, she is no longer able to meet customer demand due to her limited capital, which forces her to buy her stock at retail.  

She is seeking this loan to strengthen her working capital by diversifying her merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy, etc.). This should help to bolster her profits. She plans to reinvest a portion of these profits in her activity to cover some business expenses, and she will use the remainder to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy, etc.

loans.name: Irene Elizabeth

texts.es:
IRENE TIENE 23 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON EL COMPAÑERO Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

IRENE SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO DE IRENE ES MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS PARA TENER MAS PRODUCION Y PAGAR UNAS DEUDAS.

LE GUSTA BAILAR Y VER NOVELAS.
texts.en:
Irene is 23 years old and in a common-law relationship with her partner. They and their children live in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “El Laurel” is located the neighborhood of El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Irene is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. In addition, she raises chickens and pigs. This loan will help her to invest in seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops and balanced feed for her animals. The loan will also be helpful with increasing production.

Irene dreams of improving her crops so that she can produce more and use the earnings to pay off some debts. In her free time, she enjoys dancing and watching soap operas.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Jimmy Francisco

texts.es: Jimmy, de oficio comerciante, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, dueño de una pulpería. El solicito su primer crédito para comprar mercadería para surtir su pulpería, esto le permitió el mejorar sus ingresos, suplir parte de las necesidades de sus clientes. Ahora quiere surtir de nuevos productos su pulpería, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar cosméticos, shampoo, cremas para la piel ,productos de limpieza, granos básicos. Esto le permitirá seguir ofreciendo variedad, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jimmy, a shopkeeper, lives in Granada where he owns a small general store.  He is requesting his first loan to purchase merchandise to stock his store, which will permit him to meet some of his customers’ needs.  Now, he wishes to stock his store with new products such as cosmetics, shampoo, skin cream, cleaning products, and basic grains.  This will allow him to continue offering variety, attract new customers, and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  cosmetics, shampoo, skin cream, cleaning products, and basic grains.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: EL SR. LEPOLDO TIENE 56 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UN HOMBRE VIUDO DESDE HACE YA VARIOS AÑOS Y TIENE 3 HIJOS GRANDES. VIVE SOLO EN SU CASA Y TIENE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO DE ABARROTES UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO. EL SR. LEOPOLDO DESEA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, YA QUE DESDE HACE MAS DE 12 AÑOS, ES LA UNICA FUENTE DE INGRESOS QUE TIENE PARA CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES. POR ESTE MOTIVO SOLICITA EL APOYO DE UN PRESTAMO PARA REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA NUEVA QUE LE DE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE OFRECER MAS VARIEDAD A SUS CLIENTES Y LE AYUDE A IMPULSAR MAS SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is 56 years old. He became a widower several years ago and has three adult children. He lives alone in his house and owns a general store which is located in his home. 

Leopoldo wants to expand his business, because for over twelve years it has been the only source of income he has had to cover his expenses.

That is why he is requesting a loan to help him purchase new merchandise that will allow him to offer his customers more variety and to stimulate his business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is now married and has two children. He is still running his general store and now his income has increased to 24,000 KES. 

This is will be Titus' third loan with KADET LTD, after successfully paying his previous loans well. He is going to use this loan to purchase sugar, rice, some bales of maize flour, and cooking oil for resale. He plans to use the profits to repay his loan and the will use the remaining amount to buy a plot of land. 

His hope and dream is to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, some bales of maize flour, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives in Sisian Town with her husabnd, son and daughter. Naira is a lawyer and works at a local company and her husband works at a construcion company. However, the couple also run a farm, which allows them to have independant source of income besides their salaries. 

Naira and her husband raise cattle and cultivate wheat, barley and potatoes. Naira has applied for this loan to purchase two heifers. This will allow Naira to keep increasing their number of cattle and earn additional income.

loans.use: to pay for two heifers.

loans.name: Doaa

texts.en:
Doaa is a 23-year-old single woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is requesting a 500 JOD loan to buy clothes and sell them afterwards. In the future, she plans to buy larger amounts of clothing for resale and open a small shop.

Since Doaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Memkadi

texts.en:
Memkadi lives with her husband and their six children. She manages a convenience food stall that sells basic dishes. This business has emerged as an alternative to generate revenue. It has grown slowly through her experience over eight years. Memkadi's hours are from 5:30 am until 8:00 pm.
 
Memkadi is requesting a loan to invest in the business by buying meats, beans, firewood, and cooking oil. This loan will help to improve her availability and the business, and thus increase her profits.

Memkadi's aspiration is to have her own retail shop in the future, and to work with money for her business so that she can improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy meat, beans, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en: Yousra is a 45-year-old single woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy materials for her beauty salon and she would like to improve and expand her salon. She hopes to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mwanausi

texts.en:
Mwanausi, 40, lives with her life companion and their three children in her own house. She sells basic dishes in a small food stall such as beans, flat breads, and dumplings, among others. She’s had this small business for years, and it has provided her with a good sales experience. She has a large clientele, because people prefer her due to her quality foods, hygienic practices, accessible prices, and above all for her excellent service.

Mwanausi is an enterprising, energetic woman who very much wants to get ahead. She is always looking for alternatives that will open doors to a more prosperous future, and she does not plan to give up until she reaches it.

The demand for more varieties of foods has increased, and so she is requesting a loan to invest in her business so as to meet these demands. She plans to purchase meat, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc. She is sure that she will be able to repay the loan while offering her family a full life at the same time.

loans.use: To purchase meat, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 33 year old married woman who has five family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements; she wants to do maintenance on the rooms.  She hopes to buy new electronics and create a comfortable space for her family.

(Due to cultural reasons Shireen prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet.  The above photo is of her brother.)

loans.use: to buy new electronics.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 27 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city.  He graduated from Yerevan State Medical University and now he attends the same University’s clinical study courses (residency). He is a first year student of residency and his specialization is, ear, nose and throat (ENT). 

Sargis is asking for a 400.000 AMD loan to pay for his tuition fee for the first semester.  He is sure that after graduation he will be able to get a job in a hospital.  He has always dreams of being a doctor. 

Now he works as an engineer assistant. His present occupation allows him to support himself and his younger brother as well.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Mwamize

texts.en:
Mwamize is 35 years old and lives in the town of Msambweni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Mwamize has been working hard to manage her food stall where she sells various foodstuffs. She also sells petrol to motorcycle taxi operators.

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Yehu. This is her third loan. She will use half of the loan to buy foodstuffs like wheat flour, sugar, etc. and half to buy gallons of petrol. The loan will help Mwamize to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to get more loans from Yehu to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol and foodstuffs like wheat flour, sugar, etc

loans.name: Ameenah

texts.en: Ameenah is a 35 year old divorced female.  She has requested a 400 JOD loan to open a clothes and cosmetics shop.  In the future, she would like to have a retail store and increase her family income.

loans.use: to open a clothes and cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Mnani

texts.en:
