She’s requesting a loan to purchase more rice, okra, peppers, and palm oil for her business. She would like to own her own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, okra, peppers, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna lives in Kapan town with her husband, son, daughter and pensioner father-in-law. Syuzanna's husband is a police officer and helps Syuzanna to run the farm, where they breed cows and keep 25 beehives. 

Syuzanna has applied for this loan to expand her farm. With the requested amount she plans to purchase 2 cows and 8 colonies of bees. This will allow Syuzanna to receive and sell more milk and honey and increase agricultural profit. This is important for Syuzanna to sustain her family and ensure a prosperous life for them.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and 8 colonies of bees

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 23 years old and lives in Gardnersville, Liberia.  She is married.  Her husband is a builder, and they have three children, one of whom lives at home and attends school.

Patience has operated a cook shop (restaurant) for five years.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother.  Her main challenges are price increases for the things she buys.  She is happy when she sells her food and when her food is finished on time.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, charcoal by the bag, peppers and oil to continue her cook shop business.  She would like to have money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase food and supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is 45 years old.  She is married to a businessman.  She owns a boutique where she sells different merchandise.  She has requested a loan to buy more salt, soaps and cooking oil for sale.  The profits from her business will go towards increasing her savings.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Kapan town with her husband, son, and daughter. Anush and her husband are involved in cattle breeding: they raise cows and chickens. 

Anush would like to increase the number of cattle, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the requested amount she plans to purchase a cow and a calf. Anush hopes to gather more milk, from the sales of which she will get enough income to cover her family's costs and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 26 years old. She is married and has three children. She has a boutique and she has been running the boutique for four years. with the loan, she wants to add new merchandise in the boutique such as soaps, cooking oil, biscuits and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To add new merchandise in a boutique.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be outgoing and warm. She operates a grocery stall where she sells tomatoes . Her business is located in a residential business area  and her primary customers are local residents  and shop retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be few customers to sell the tomatoes to. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy boxes (crates)  for packaging tomatoes for selling to customers. Her business goal is to be a supplier of tomatoes to other small scale groceries  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of her family .

loans.use: to buy boxes ( crates) for packaging tomatoes for selling to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish and condiments in bulk for her food stand

loans.name: Sadeyeh

texts.en:
Sadeyeh is a 40-year-old married female from Al Nasser, Jordan. She has two children. 

She requested a 400 JOD loan to buy women’s and children’s clothing and sell them afterwards. 

She would like to improve her situation, and in the future she would like to have her own shop and get her children educated.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes and then sell them.

loans.name: Jussy

texts.en:
Jussy is 34 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children; 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jussy has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jussy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes  for resale and will help Jussy to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Jussy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Jussy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jussy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 35 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She attended school and is a high school graduate. She is married and her husband is a driver.  They have five children who are in school and live at home.  

Comfort has been buying and selling soap, drinks, water.  The biggest problem is when business is slow.  She is proud that her business means that they never go hungry.  She started the business with money from her husband. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more soap, drinks, water for her business. She would like to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, drinks, water for her business

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single and has one child. For the past 6 years, Amos has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, maize flour and dry beans. 

To help expand his business, Amos has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Amos to generate greater profits and improve his family standards of living. Amos hopes that in the future he will be able to have the best stocked shop in the center and own a mini supermarket. 

Amos is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amos who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale,

loans.name: Jesus Reel De Bras De Lance Group

texts.fr:
Edilienne est la coordinatrice de son groupe JESUS REEL DE BRAS DE LANCE. Elle est une veuve  et elle a 3 enfants. Edilienne  habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Edilienne a dirigé son commerce vente de la nourriture cuite pendant les dernières 6 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, elle cultivait la terre. Elle  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans un restaurant dont il vend des produits divers tels que boissons gazeuses. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Edilienne dit que ses défi principal sont les manques d'achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit.
Edilienne dit que son but principal  est  d'avoir un  pret plus d'argent pour obtenir un plus grand commerce avec l'aide de DIEU. Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, le produits divers et cosmetiques.
texts.en:
Edilienne is the coordinator of her group JESUS REEL DE BRAS DE LANCE. She is a widow and has three children. She lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Edilienne has been running her business selling cooked foods for the last six years. Before starting this business, she used to be a farmer. She would like to use this loan to invest in a restaurant in which to sell various items, such as soft drinks. She hopes that this loan will help her to have a larger business.

She says that her main challenges include a lack of customers and too many people asking her for credit. She says her main goal is to have a larger loan in order to have a larger business, with God's help. 

The other members of her group have need of a loan for such businesses as a variety store or selling cosmetic products.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as fizzy drinks to sell

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna lives in Goris town with her husband. The couple keeps chickens, cultivates potatoes and beans, and grows fruit trees.

Zhanna would like to purchase special incubators in which she can keep eggs for a few weeks before they become chickens. Zhanna will then sell the chickens. She also wants to purchase wheat and barley to feed the chickens. In addition, she plans to increase the number of chickens by purchasing 150 more. 

The implementation of all these goals will help Zhanna to earn more income from agriculture and invest in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for chickens, wheat, barley, and two incubators for chickens.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a 32-year-old married mother of four, has enjoyed great success as a retail shop proprietor in Mombasa for the past five years. This will be Jane’s third business loan from KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan.

Jane hopes to have a well-known business and maintain her happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Tolors village, Syunik region, with her husband and daughter. 

Marine and her husband are involved in agriculture: they raise cows, lambs, and chickens and cultivate potatoes. 

Marine has applied for this loan to purchase grass. This will allow her to feed the cattle during the winter and continue developing the farm.

loans.use: to pay for grass to feed the cattle this winter.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is from Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. She is married, with eight children. Her eldest is 23 years old, and her youngest is 3. 

It is quite a challenge for her to provide for her children while she relies on hog raising and a food-vending business for an income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her hogs and ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, soy sauce, and other seasonings. Her loan will serve as an additional income to better sustain her business. 

Her profit will be for her family's daily consumption and school fees. In the future, she would like to make a bigger barn and to cook more diishes to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jescar

texts.en:
Jescar is a 40-year-old landlady in Mariakani and a married mother of four. She has been a landlady for the past seven years, and she is doing great. 

This is her eighth loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to renovate her rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to build more houses for rent. She hopes to own several rental houses in Mombasa.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 years old and is from Kaiboi. She is married with three kids. She has been in the second-hand clothing business for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

This is her first loan with KADET, LTD. and she plans to use the amount of 20,000 KES to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for resale. She will use the profits from the business for loan repayment and the remaining amount on sustaining her family. 

She hopes to open a clothing shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 36 ans fiancée, mère d'enfants, qui vont encore à l'école. Elle a ouvert un restaurant à l'air libre qu'elle gère depuis 5 ans déjà. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'acheter 2 sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et un carton de poisson frais pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour refaire les locaux de son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 36-year-old woman who is engaged to be married. She is the mother of one child, who still goes to school. Marie opened an open-air restaurant that she has been running for five years now. Thanks to this business, she is taking care of her family. 

Given that she makes her purchases at the retail level, her restaurant does not really bring in much profit for her, thus the importance of this loan for her business, since it will enable her to buy 2 sacks of peanuts, a sack of rice, and a box of fresh fish for makgin her dishes. This will prevent her from having to make daily trips and will reduce her taxi costs. It will also increase her profits. She will reinvest part of her profits in fixing up her location and in meeting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a box of fresh fish, rice, and peanuts to cook and sell at her open-air restaurant

loans.name: Munay Tika Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcosa ella es casada y tiene 49 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de maíz,la socia tiene un negocio de agricultura,ella cultiva maíz,papa y trigo,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de chicha y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de maíz,la socia ya se dedica 10 años al negocio de venta de maíz y venta de chicha,la socia vende maíz en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir con sus hijos a pasear,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maíz y tambien la chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor y tambien insumos para que prepare chicha.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de fruta y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Munay Tika communal bank.  This bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Marcosa, a member, is 49 years old, married, and has six children.  She works in her business of selling corn.  She has a farming business.  She grows corn, potatoes, and wheat.  She also has a business selling “chicha” [a corn based drink].  She sells corn at the market from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

In her free time she likes to go out and take walks with her children.  Marcosa’s dream is to have a place where she is able to sell corn and also chicha.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn wholesale and to buy ingredients to make chicha.

The other members have farming businesses. There is a business selling vegetables, a business selling fruit, and a grocery store.

Marcosa is grateful to those that make up part of this dream through the loan.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and to buy ingredients to make chicha.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 55 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 23 and 35. Only one is a student attending high school; the others have completed their studies. She wants a loan to buy more nets for use in fishing. She has been a fisher for nine years. She plans to use the profits to buy cows that can provide milk for the health of the family.

loans.use: to buy nets for catching fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children, 12 and 16 years old, who live at home and attend school. 

For the past ten years Patricia has been selling coal and pepper.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal, okra, bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable), and pepper for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, okra, bitter ball, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, a married father of four children ranging from 1 to 12 years of age, describes himself as a polite, jovial and self-motivated man. For the past three years Benard has operated a business providing motorcycle transportation services. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is insecurity within the area.

Benard will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy a taxi to provide transportation services to tourists from Kisumu airport to various areas within the next five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married, with two kids. She has been in the cereals business for the past 20 years, earning about KES 7,400 monthly. 

This is her second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She has borrowed KES 20,000 and plans to use it on purchasing dry maize for resale.  With the anticipated profits, she plans to use it in repaying her loan and in running her business. 

She hopes to open another cereals shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize for resale.

loans.name: Linny

texts.en:
Linny is 25 years old and is from Kaiboi. She is married with four kids. She has been in the second-hand clothing business for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

This is her first loan with KADET, LTD. and she plans to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for resale. She will use the profits from the business on loan repayment and the remaining amount on sustaining her family. 

She hopes to open a clothing shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jilani

texts.en:
Jilani is a 38-year-old timber seller in Kilifi. He is a married father of five, and he has been selling timber for the past two years with success.

This marks his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more timber. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business and use the rest to educate his children. 

He hopes to excel in this business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more timber.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 33-year-old timber seller in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is married, and he has been selling timber for the past five years with success.

This marks his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more timber. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business. 

He hopes to excel in this business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase more timber.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is now 37 years old and is still operating her tailoring business in Mombasa. Her business has been doing well and she is grateful for that. 

This is Claris' second business loan from KADET, LTD.,which she is using to finance her business. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads, and clothing materials. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase clothing materials and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have a bigger, successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads, and clothing materials

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 32 года. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Фарход имеет среднее образование. Он более пяти лет занимается скотоводством. Фарход разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Он берет кредит для закупа теленка и овец.
texts.en:
Farhod is a thirty-two-year-old married man who lives with his wife in Kulob, Tajikistan. His wife takes care of their household while Farhod makes a living by breeding cattle. For the past five years he's run this business of breeding and fattening cattle for sale. 

He's asking for a loan in order to purchase a calf and some sheep.

loans.use: to buy a calf and sheep.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 42 years old and lives in Gardnersville, She is single and has three children between 9 and 19 years old. For the past 3 years, she has been selling bonnie fish, meat, etc., in the market.  She started the business with money from her mother. She’s requesting a loan to purchase bonnie fish, meat, etc., for her business. She would like to  enlarge her business and run her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase bonnie fish, meat, etc., for her business

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard runs a shop, where she sells flowers and gifts. She started this business about 5 months ago, and during this short period, due to friendly service and original design of bouquets, Alvard has gained a large number of loyal customers. Now Alvard needs to increase the variety of flowers in the shop, for which she has applied for this loan.  It is important for Alvard to stay competitive in the market and keep stable development of her business, ensuring prosperity for her family. Alvard lives with her husband, two daughters and parents-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for flowers

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a 32-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has five young children. 

Regie is a fisherman, and he has been in this business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income.

Regie is in need of additional capital for his business. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to repair his fishing boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.

In the future, Regie dreamed of expanding his business. Moreover, he wants to earn more for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 22-year-old salon owner in Mariakani. She is single and has been running her business for the past two years successfully.

This marks her first loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase new blow driers, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals, and hair rollers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and open another salon. 

She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase new blow driers, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals, and hair rollers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 25 year-old clothes dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is single and has been selling clothes for the past four years with success.

This marks his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers. He will use the anticipated profits to open another clothes shop. He hopes to excel in this business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers.

loans.name: Soltei

texts.en:
Soltei is now 31 years old.  He is married and blessed with four children. He has been in this business for the last four years and it earns him a monthly income of 12,150 shillings.


This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy more livestock like goats, sheep, and cows for resale.  He hopes to be a prominent livestock farmer.

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo is 61 years old and lives in a small village of Zestaponi district. She has a husband, two grown sons, a granddaughter and a daughter-in-law. Dodo and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. Dodo’s daughter-in-law works in Greece to help her family. Her sons are builders and get monthly income. Dodo is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, she has a plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. In addition, the family owns a vineyard.  They pick grapes and produce wine and vodka.  Besides these activities, Dodo has a small dairy farm. She owns 3 milking cows and produces cheese. She has 2 pigs as well. Dodo sells her agricultural and dairy production locally: grapes, wine, vodka, cheese and piglets.

She requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. Dodo will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis is still running his retail shop in Mariakani and is happy that his business is able to meet his family's needs. 

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business and repay his loan.  He hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: To purchase more salt, sugar, washing detergents and maize flour.

loans.name: Olma

texts.ru:
Олме 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. С самых ранних лет она занималась шитьем. После занятий в школе она шила платье девушкам и женщинам своего кишлака, чтобы зарабатывать деньги для содержания семьи. После замужество она продолжала  свое дело и на добавок занималась скотоводством. Чтобы прокормить детей муж Олмы начал продавать мясо скота, которого откармливала Олма. Уже более 20 лет она занимается этим бизнесом. 
Олма хочет, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее младшая дочь поступила в университет в этом году, но у Олмы нет денег для оплаты учебы ее дочери. Она запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы в университет. Она и ее дочь ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Olma is forty-seven years old. She's married and a mother to three children. Olma is very hard working and driven. She began sewing in her childhood. She would sew dresses for women and girls in her village after school in order to support her family. She continued to sew after marriage while helping her husband raise cattle. She would fatten the cattle and her husband would sell the meat so that they could feed their children. This has been their livelihood for the past twenty years. 

Olma wants her children to receive a good education. Her youngest daughter was accepted to a university this year, but they don't have enough money to pay the tuition fees. She's asking for a loan in order to pay them. They hope for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughters' college tuition.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en: Ma. Luisa is 38 years old and comes from Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has two dependent children. Ma. Luisa and her husband have been engaged in their fishing business for 10 years now. This is her main livelihood to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon for fishing net repair and materials for making a fence. These will be helpful so their fishing activity will be more productive and successful. The income that they will generate from fishing will be used to buy healthy meals for her family and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon for fishing net repair and materials for making fence

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
Chacha is now fifty years old.  He is married to Jackline, who assists him in farming. They are blessed with two children.  He has been in this business for seven years now and earns a monthly income of thirteen thousand one hundred shillings. 

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to support his farming business by buying seedlings, sprays, insecticides, and tomatoes.
He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy more acres of land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 34 years old. She lives in the village of Shilda, Kakheti Region, with her family -- her husband and parents-in-law. Salome’s parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land, where maize is grown. In addition, Salome owns a vineyard. 

The family picks grapes and produces wine, which is sold locally. Salome owns two milk cows and a calf. She milks the cows every day and produces cheese and sells it at the local market. 

Besides her business, she works as a nurse and gets a monthly income. Salome is very hard-working woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to build a kitchen. Salome had planned to sell a cow to purchase building materials.  With this credit, she will be able to keep the cow and buy necessary things for the kitchen. She will continue her dairy business and sell cheese again. This will increase the income of the family. 

With the increased income, Salome plans to purchase calves and expand her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en: Tawah lives in Gardernesville.  She is 35 years old, married, and has three children, ages 5 to 13.  Her children live at home and attend school.  For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes.  She learned this way of selling from her mother and started her business with money given to her by her mother.  She enjoys the flow of customers and the profit she receives each day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 52 years old and lives in a small village with her family. She has a husband, a grown son and a daughter-in-law. Her husband has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Marine’s son works at a warehouse and gets a monthly salary. Marine is involved in the dairy business. In particular, she has a milk cow and a calf. Marine milks the cow every day and produces cheese, which is sold locally. She is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.
Marine requested a loan for purchasing food for cattle.  She will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cow during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now and the price increases by 30-40% in the fall months. Marine significantly saves on the costs of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family.  This will increase the family income and Marine will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 47 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She’s married and her husband is a businessman.  They have five children between 10 and 25 years old, who live at home.   Three attend school.  For the past twenty years, Alice has been selling use clothes.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more use clothes for her business.  She plans is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more use clothes for her business

loans.name: Tomor

texts.en:
Tomor is 54 and married. He is an Egyptian from the vulnerable ethnic minority community of Albanian-Egyptians living in the southeastern part of the country, in the suburbs of a major city. He has two children, 23 and 16 years old who both attend school. He is the only financial supporter for his family.

For the past eight years, Tomor has been selling and transporting goods with his truck. The services he has been offering to locals are in demand in the region where he serves. Through these services, he has been able to build a little house for his family. Recently, his truck broke down and now needs repairing. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan from Kiva and hopes that lenders will be supporting him. In return, his promise is that he will pay back the loan just like he has in the past the other three loans.

loans.use: To repair the truck

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es:
SILVIA TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON EL COMPAÑERO Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

SILVA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO DE SILVIA ES MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS PARA TENER MAS PRODUCION

 LE GUSTA SALIR DE PASEO CON LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old and in a common-law relationship with her partner. They live with their children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “El Laurel” is located the neighborhood of El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Silvia is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. In addition, she raises chickens and pigs. This loan will help her to invest in seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops and balanced feed for her animals. The loan will also be helpful with increasing production.

Silvia dreams of improving her crops so that she can produce more. She enjoys going for walks with her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en:
Samiha is a 48-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan. She has four children and has requested a 600 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for home improvements and painting. In the future, she would like to buy a house. 

For cultural reasons, Samiha prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her son.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en: Ma. Magdalena is 47 years old from the community of Cortes, Bohol. She is married and has one child who is 15 years old. Ma. Magdalena is a Sari-sari store owner and is also in a hog raising business. She is doing her best so she can be of help in raising her family. In her store, she sells basic household items like toiletries, seasoning, snack foods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy in bulk more soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries. The income that she will generate will help her in buying a healthy diet. In the future, she would like to venture into other business opportunities and make a bigger barn for her hogs for a better income.

loans.use: to buy in bulk more soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
Rabina is a merchant who has run a sari-sari (or convenience) store for more than 12 years. This is the source of her income. Rabina works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Rabina needs additional funds for the expansion of her business. She is requesting a loan worth 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles and other dry goods, snack foods, etc. With this loan, she will be able to augment her stock and attract more customers in her store.

In the future, Rabina dreams of improving her family's standard of living. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school to attain higher levels of learning and education.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles and other dry goods, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Esma

texts.en:
Esma is 37 years old. She lives in the Kaspi district with her parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. 

Esma runs her animal husbandry business. She owns a milk cow, a calf and four pigs. She milks the cow every day and produces dairy products which are sold locally. She sells piglets as well. Esma is a very hardworking woman, but she still doesn't have enough income to make some savings and expand her animal husbandry business.

She requested a loan to purchase food for the pigs. Esma plans to raise them and sell them during the winter season. This will increase her income. With the increased income, she will be able to expand her business and make it more profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food for the pigs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabita is 33 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 2.  

In 2005, Sabita established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her store.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  

Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  

While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

In the future, Sabita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods in bulk for her store.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 9.  

In 2005, she established her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

In the future, Sarita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Juana Elizabeth sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO” y las reuniones del banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

La socia Juana Elizabeth tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de accesorios para carros, ella vende aceites, tornillos, parabrisas, llantas y entre otros repuestos.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios de carros como, fundas, tornillo, llantas, pistones y parabrisas al por mayor. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Juana Elizabeth continues to belong to the communal bank Santo Domingo, and the bank's meetings are located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Juana Elizabeth is 41 years old, single, and has two children.  She is a native of the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  She makes a living through the business of selling spare parts for cars.  She sells motor oil, screws, windshields, tires, and other parts.  She has already spent many years in this business and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in her work.  This time she needs the loan in order to buy spare car parts like covers, screws, tires, pistons and windshields at wholesale cost.  The member is happy for the loan and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts like covers, screws, tires, pistons and windshields at wholesale cost.

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Ratna Shova is 45 years old.   She is married and has two children, ages 28 and 24.  

In 1998, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

 In the future, Ratna Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Corazon Group

texts.en:
Mariela is a single woman, 23 years of age.  She lives with her parents and several siblings in a rural area of Pachaj, Totonicapán, Guatemala. 

Mariela is a weaver.  She uses the ancient back-strap loom method, learned from her mother from a young age, to hand-weave a variety of products.  She sells her pieces on the side of a road in a market that is about 20 minutes from her home. 

Despite her young age, Mariela believes that she has overcome many challenges in her life.  Although she was an outstanding student, family circumstances forced her to drop out of school in the sixth grade.  She remains very positive and is focusing her energy and passion on building her business.

Mariela is so excited to have found Friendship Bridge.  This will be her first loan cycle with the organization and her first experience with a microloan.  With her new loan, she plans to buy a sewing machine to start a new garment business. Mariela says, "I am so happy to receive this loan, since it will ignite my dream."

Along with Mariela, eight additional women make up the Trust Bank Corazon (heart).  These ladies meet once a month with Friendship Bridge staff to receive a participatory non-formal education, which will help to reinforce their knowledge in important aspects in daily life, such as women's health, self-esteem, hygiene, loan and business management and administration, among others. 

Mariela indicates that she is very happy to be able to meet with her friends for these meetings over next 12 months (the length of the loan).  Her loan will not only provide essential capital to start her dream business, but the participatory lessons will also allow her to continue her education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ayni Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal AYNI; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Noemí, la socia tiene 61 años de edad, casada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lavandería, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, la socia trabaja con distintos hoteles que solicitan sus servicios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera poder salir adelante y seguir apoyando a su familia

La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de las maquinas.

Los otros socios se dedican a la hotelería, venta de artesania, turismo, docencia, enfermería.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the AYNI communal bank which is located in the district of Wanchaq, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member Noemí is 61 years old is married and has 5 children. She goes between her daily activities with her laundry business and has done so for a long time. Noemí does well in her business thanks to the hard work that she puts in as she works for different hotels that require her services. The member is a very responsible and diligent person since it is the way she is able to help her family get ahead in life. The member wishes to keep working so that she can get ahead and continue to support her family.

The member needs the loan to make maintenance repairs to her laundry machines.

The other members of the communal bank are in the hotel business, selling artisanal goods, tourism, education and nursing.

Noemí is grateful for the loan and is committed to meeting all of her payment quotas.

loans.use: make maintenance repairs to her laundry machines.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.en:
In one of the rural areas of San Francisco El Alto, located in the western part of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Mrs. Ceferina and her family strive every day looking for a better life.

Ceferina, 40 years old, has seven children (two girls and five boys). She and her husband are dedicated to garments, including formal outfits, pants, sweat suits, and school uniforms, among others.

Nine women including Ceferina formed the trust bank called Luz y Vida (Light and Life) in August last year. Each one of these ladies have paid back their loans successfully, and now they all are moving to a new loan cycle.

The first loan was a huge boost for Ceferina’s business because it gave her three potential new clients, who are demanding considerable amounts of products. Ceferina and her husband have recently employed five people. They supply them with materials so they can finish making the products. That way Cerefina can cover all the demands of her customers.  

Ceferina did not hesitate to start a new loan cycle with Friendship Bridge Organization because she has more demand than usual for this time of the year. She will use this new loan to buy fabric and thread to distribute to her employees so they can start working on the existing orders. Ceferena is satisfied that she is able to support other people’s economy by giving jobs to these five people, who also have large families.

Ceferina in turn appreciates the effort and dedication of people throughout the world who are supporting the progress of rural communities in Guatemala, where access to loans is limited, but there are people who trust and believe in them.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika sigue perteneciendo  al banco comunal “Santo Domingo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Erika tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se sigue teniendo su restaurant, ella sigue preparando  desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella sigue preparando platos como pollo al horno, estofado de pollo, sopas y entre otros platos. 

La socia Erika solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para compra por ejemplo pollo, carnes, verduras y fideos al por mayor, ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Erika continues to be a part of the Santo Domingo communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member Erika is 45 years old and has a common law marriage of which she has three children. Erika is a native of the city of Cusco, a place where she was born and continues to live and established her restaurant. She still continues to make breakfasts, lunches and diners and preparing dishes like baked chicken, braised chicken, soups, etc.

Erika needs the loan to buy foodstuffs wholesale like chicken, meats, vegetables, and spaghetti. She is happy to have the loan and is committed to making all her payments.

loans.use: buy foodstuffs wholesale like chicken, meats, vegetables, and spaghetti.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Living Jesus Group

texts.en:
Eva is 32 years old. She is married with three children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education and also to help her spouse to build their house. 

She belongs to the community group called Living Jesus Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 47 years old and married. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has two children who have helped her in taking care of their corn. They have been in planting corn for 20 years and earn PHP 6,890 a month. 

This year, Avelina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina, se dedica a prestar servicio con un molino de nixtamal, también administrar una pequeña tienda de productos domésticos, es madre soltera de tres hijos, sus negocios le han ayudado para poder salir adelante con sus necesidades, éstos han surgido por iniciativa propia y tiene más de dos años de estar atendiendo.

Solicita este prestamo para comprarse materiales para la tienda, como lo son jabones, detergentes, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, y también invertirá una parte en la compra de discos para los molinos, fajas; el crédito le ayudará a mejorar su servicio en el negocio y a continuar trabajando por el bienestar familiar.

Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio a futuro y tener un local para el molino donde pueda brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evangelina provides grinding services for making cornmeal. She also manages a small store where she sells household products. Evangelina is a single mother with three children. Her businesses have helped her get ahead with providing for their needs. She started her businesses through her own initiative and they have been in operation for more than two years.

Evangelina is requesting a loan so that she can buy goods for her store such as soap, detergents, beans, rice, and sugar. She will also invest part of the loan in the purchase of discs and belts for her grain mill. The loan will help to improve the service in her business and to continue working so that she can provide for her family’s welfare.

Her goals are to expand her business in the future and to have a shop for her grain mill where her customers will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and discs and belts for her grain mill.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic lives in Molicay, Ozamis City. She has earned income through providing transportation services for five years to support the needs of her four children. She gets an income of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for this business. 

For a 39-year-old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Marivic borrows the amount of 6,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business and provide her children a better education. She joined GDMPC in 2009. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old, married with one child, and resides at Santa Cruz, Tangub City, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas to earn a living, which she has been doing for 25 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

Teresita has requested a loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds and seedlings to raise. She has been a member of Mindanao cooperative GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and support her child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional banana seeds and seedlings to raise.

loans.name: Llapallanchis Purisunchis Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS; este banco está situado en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juana, la socia tiene 75 años de edad, viuda y tiene 09 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  a su negocio ,la socia a la vez vende fruta  en la puerta de su tienda ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante y puede seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como gaseosas.

Los otros socios se dedican a la artesania, venta de flores, venta de artefactos, carpintería, transporte, servicio de taxi.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank "LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS", which is located in the department of Cusco. 

The group member, Juana, is 75 years old. She is a widow and has 9 children. Along with her daily activities she also runs a grocery store. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, snacks, sodas and other things. She has had this business for many years. Her business does well thanks to the determination she applies to her work. She also sells fruit from outside the door of her store. She is a responsible and earnest person, which allows her to get ahead and continue helping her family. 

The communal bank member requested the loan to buy merchandise, like sodas, for her store.  

The other communal bank members make a living working as artisans, selling flowers, selling artifacts, doing carpentry, providing transportation, and providing taxi service.   

The communal group member is thankful for the loan that is being provided and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to restock her store with things like sodas.

loans.name: Ceriss

texts.en:
Ceriss is a married mother of two. She is 31 years old and lives in Malaubang, Osamiz City, in the Philippines. Ceriss owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, which she established as a way of generating extra income of 9,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She has been engaged in this business for four years. 

Ceriss has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. She has been a good member of GDMPC since 2010 and, in the future, wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Xiomara Deyanira

texts.es: Xiomara  Deyanira de  32 años de edad, acompañada con un hijo de tres años su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, la cual consiste en la venta de pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otros, ella distribuye su mercadería de forma ambulante y a domicilio, tiene 9 años de experiencia con una pulpería y poco a poco fue cambiando el negocio en la actualidad vende solamente mercadería en general. El  uso del préstamo para invertir en el inventario de su mercadería y  compra ropa nueva variada.
texts.en:
Xiomara Deyanira is 32 years old and lives with her three-year-old son. Her business involves selling general merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and other items. She sells her merchandise as a street vendor and from home. Xiomara has nine years of experience managing a grocery store and gradually transitioned into her current business of selling only general merchandise.

This loan will be invested in merchandise for her inventory, such as a variety of new clothing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra Rosa tiene 26 años, es casada y no tiene hijos, vive en su casa propia en un barrio muy tranquilo.
La Sra Rosa y su marido fabrican chipitas y palitos salados. Ambos se encuentran en el negocio por que les va muy bien y cuentan con una clientela formada  y venden a un precio accesible.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para hacer las chipas y los palitos salados, como aceites para fritar, almidón, leche, harina de maíz, etc.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old, she is married and does not have any children. She lives in her own home, in a very calm neighborhood. 

Rosa and her husband make "chipitas" (a traditional cheese bread) and "palitos salados" (salty bread sticks). They both work in the business because it is doing very well. They have a good customer base and have reasonable prices.

She has requested a loan to buy products in bulk to make the "chipitas" and "palitos salados", like cooking oil for frying, starch, milk, corn flour, etc.

loans.use: to buy products like cooking oil, corn flour, starch, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making ice candy.

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Beryl has a printing shop that prints tarpaulins and banners. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed in printing.

Beryl is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Beryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in printing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a widow and the mother of six children. She is 52 years old and lives in the village of Kinuman Sur in Ozamis City. Susan owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 8 years. Susan requested a loan of 6,500 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Susan has been a good member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Susan wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena  is  47  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Rowena  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. 

In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Kristiel

texts.en:
Kristiel  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children. 

Kristiel  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Kristiel is a new member of HSPFI.

In the future, Kristiel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa  is  44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children.

Elisa  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for nine  years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks,and beverages.  Elisa is a new member of HSPFI. 

In the future, Elisa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child.
Ailene has a small store from which she sells dried fish and spices. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish and spices to sell.
Ailene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ailene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish and spices to sell.

loans.name: Pillao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PILLAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delfina ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,anteriormente la socia se dedicaba al negocio de venta de chicha en el mercado, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el sueño de la socia es tener un local más amplio para su tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y galletas al por  mayor para que implemente su tienda de abarrotes.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de carpintería, negocio de venta de crianza de animales, negocio de venta de tejas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Pillao communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Delfina, she is married and is 53 years old and has 6 children. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic household goods like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. Mrs. Delfina works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., before she used to work selling chicha (a type of fermented corn drink) in the market. She has had her store for over 5 years and her dream is to have a bigger place to sell her groceries. The member needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies wholesale.

The other members of the communal bank work in carpentry, breeding animals, selling roofing tile, have a small grocery store and sell food.

The member is grateful to those who will help her with her dream come through with this loan and she is committed to meeting all of her payment quotas on time.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies wholesale.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La Sra Agustina tiene 60 años es casada con dos hijos y viven la casa de su madre.
La sra se dedica a alquilar sillas, mesas, manteles, globo loco para los mas chicos y demás servicios. Como la señora es una de las pocas personas que se dedican a este rubro, no tiene mucha competencia pero de igual forma debe estar al tanto sus mercaderías.
El crédito sera invertido en la compra de manteles y cubiertos ya que la buena presentacion de sus alquileres es esencial para la buena recepcion de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agustina is 60 years old, is married and has two children; they live in their mothers’ home.

Mrs. Agustina rents tables, chairs, tablecloths, jumping houses for the children and other services. Since she is one of a few people who work in this field, she has little competition but still she has to be up to date with her merchandize.

The loan will help her buy tablecloths and eating utensils since a good presentation of her rentals is essential for her customers.

loans.use: buy chairs, tables, tablecloths, etc.

loans.name: Joanne Kristine

texts.en: Joanne Kristine of Jimenez helps her family through her transportation services business. She’s 24 years old and single, and she tries her best to earn on her own. For 3 years, she has managed this business and earns about 7,000 PHP per month. Right now, she needs to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She joined  GDMPC in 2009  and thanks the micro finance institution for the loan of 20,000  PHP they provided to her. Joanne Kristine desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras San Roque cuenta con 10 miembros mujeres que se encuentran en el 5to ciclo del programa. La mayoría de ellas son macateras y el grupo de minoría son artesanas que se dedican a tejer.El comité se caracteriza por la buena predisposición para emprender todo tipo de negocios demostrando sus talentos.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Idalia es macatera se dedica a la venta de productos como sábanas, cubre-camas, toallas, ollas, entre otros productos, de forma ambulante.
El crédito solicitado sería destinado para la compra de nuevas mercaderías y de esa forma poder crecer como vendedora y generar mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Enterprising Women of San Roque has 10 members who are in their fifth loan cycle. The majority of them are rural saleswomen and the minority group are artisans who weave. The committee is known for being able to do many types of businesses which show off their talents.

One of the members is Mrs. Idalia, she sells products like sheets, bedspreads, towels, pots and other items as a street vendor.

The loan will be used to buy new merchandize; this will help her grow as a salesperson and to have greater income.

loans.use: buy products like sheets, bedspreads, towels, pots and other items

loans.name: Ruby Ann

texts.en:
Ruby Ann is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ruby Ann has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ruby Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ruby Ann hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín de 73 años tiene una tienda, cuya experiencia se remonta dese al año 1948, cuando desde pequeña trabajaba en varios barrios de la ciudad  y fue adquiriendo experiencia y guardando dinero, que le cancelaban de su tarea diaria. Una vez reunió el dinero suficiente decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocio en un barrio del sur de la ciudad,  donde estuvo durante 6 años, hasta cuando cambió de sector  y con   grandes esfuerzos atesoró un poco mas de dinero y  logró comprar un bus urbano,  que le enfocó  su dedicación al  transporte, para después de 35 años ubicar  nuevamente su tienda en un barrio al norte de la ciudad de Barranquilla y   cuando reunió dinero, para comprar su propia casa, abrió un local e instaló su negocio y se estabilizó. Hoy vende artículos de la canasta familiar, un 30% lo hace a crédito y un 70% de contado. Sus compras las realiza en graneros de la ciudad diariamente, de contado y  en empresas que llevan las mercancías hasta su tienda mediante su pedido. Su meta es ampliar su tienda y dejarle un legado a sus hijos de trabajo y emprendimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, abarrotes, y en general productos de consumo masivo, para surtir sus vitrinas y estantería en mayor volumen, porque muchas son las veces que se queda sin capital y necesita tener un stock de artículos, siempre dispuestos a complacer a su clientela para continuar sosteniéndose en el mercado y lograr su propósito de crecimiento.
texts.en: Joaquín is 73 years old and has store, his experience begins since 1948 when as a young man he worked in different neighborhoods of the city and gained experience and saved money as he was paid his daily wages. Once he had enough money he decided to start his own business venture in a neighborhood in the southern part of the city where he was for 6 years until he moved and with great effort saved more money and was able to buy a bus. He then dedicated himself to transportation and 35 years later decided to start a small neighborhood grocery store in the northern Barranquilla, when he had enough money he was able to buy his own home and opened a small space and started his business. Today he sells basic household items, 30% of his sales are on credit and 70% are cash. He buys his merchandize daily cash down in the city and from companies that bring their items to his store as he makes his order. His goal is to expand his store and to leave his children a legacy of hard work and entrepreneurship. At present, Joaquín needs a loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he will buy merchandize, groceries and basic household goods to stock his displays and shelves with more items since many times he does not have enough capital and is in need of having some stock. He is always willing to please his customers to continue his business and to fulfill his dream of success.

loans.use: buy merchandize, groceries and basic household goods to stock his displays and shelves with more items.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Ernestina has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ernestina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ernestina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carlos Exequiel

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, realiza actividades de albañilería y también en la reparación de celulares, el vive con su esposa y una hija de cuatro meses de edad, los cultivos lo realiza hace cinco años y es aprendido por su familia, la albañilería tiene nueve años de haberla aprendido y la reparación de celulares tiene ocho años, están distintas actividades son las que le ayudan para poder generar los ingresos para su familia.

El solicita un préstamo porque está realizando la siembra de maíz, para esto necesita comprarse abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, son los necesarios para prevenir la maleza y las plagas del cultivo, también logrará invertir una parte del préstamo en la compra de repuestos para celulares, el crédito le ayudará teniendo una nueva siembra de maíz y también comprándose repuestos para el negocio de los celulares.
A futuro espera poder construir su propia casa, ampliar sus cultivos y el negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos grows corn and also works as a bricklayer. In addition, he repairs mobile phones. He lives with his wife and four-month-old daughter. Carlos has been growing crops for five years and learned this trade from his family. He has worked as a bricklayer for nine years after acquiring this skill. Carlos has been repairing mobile phones for eight years. These different business activities are what help him to generate income for his family.

He is requesting a loan because he wants to continue growing corn. Carlos needs to buy compost, herbicides, and insecticides. These supplies are necessary to prevent pests and crop diseases. He will also invest part of the loan in mobile phone parts. The loan will help him produce a new crop of corn and also buy parts for his mobile phone business.

In the future he hopes to build a house of his own, increase his crops, and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and mobile phone parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, lingerie, etc.
